commit_message:
set config_drive_format to vfat

 Fix known libvirt issue with live_migration of instances
 if ISO9660 formatted config drive is used.

Upstream Change-Id: Ie65e4b36e74acedfd840ee306f8e39833ffbad39

Change-Id: Ieb4c3a71baff11874031631ba38fd9e37197ed87
Related-Bug: #1246201
Closes-Bug: #1491841

", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Script to release cycle-with-intermediary

Script used for Swift 2.4.0 release, should be usable for any
cycle-with-intermediary items. Will probably be refactored at
some point with other release tools, but it's a good reference
to keep outside of my hard disk. This script currently only
tags on master, so it can't be used for release branch (or stable
branch) releases.

This also removes swiftrc.sh which was previously used to tag
RCs on intermediary releases of Swift. We don't do RCs on
cycle-with-intermediary items, so no point in keeping this one
around.

Change-Id: I3722e9cf222ed432a67f980bd4cd62ab83b14670

commit_message:
Remove -T option from build.py

The -T option is no longer necessary to be specified on each build.
The defaults work well enough, so remove -T 1000 from the documentation.

Change-Id: I13a9a4ac6b3f402d8ca0ba57fa1dbfd19a82ae1f

commit_message:
Cleanup tempest docs a bit

This commit fixes a few things in the tempest docs. First it fixes all
of the sphinx warnings and enables fail on warn to ensure we're using
valid sphinx everywhere. It also adds a link from the configuration
guide to the sample config file.

Change-Id: I3ad645a6bbfa46b4498e1732410743e46d6eb0cb

subject: Fix upload_image error in stackrc
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-03 15:38:37.000000000', 'files': ['stackrc'], 'message': 'Fix upload_image error in stackrc

This commit fixes error caused by adding default image path to IMAGE_URLS without ','
If user sets IMAGE_URLS in localrc like
IMAGE_URLS="path1, path2" (with a space after the comma)
the we get an error "binary operator expected" in
if [ -n $IMAGE_URLS ] condition and a comma will not be added to the end of IMAGE_URLS
In the code below we add default image path(path3) to IMAGE_URLS and we get
IMAGE_URLS="path1, path2path3"

Change-Id: I6543f7178c49a42c71ad9df4cdb4c6e78cbf7758
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix upload_image error in stackrc

This commit fixes error caused by adding default image path to IMAGE_URLS without ','
If user sets IMAGE_URLS in localrc like
IMAGE_URLS="path1, path2" (with a space after the comma)
the we get an error "binary operator expected" in
if [ -n $IMAGE_URLS ] condition and a comma will not be added to the end of IMAGE_URLS
In the code below we add default image path(path3) to IMAGE_URLS and we get
IMAGE_URLS="path1, path2path3"

Change-Id: I6543f7178c49a42c71ad9df4cdb4c6e78cbf7758

commit_message:
Modify tests to load trustee user from plugin

Use the new auth plugin format to load authentication for the trustee
user rather than reading it from auth_token middleware options.

By doing the test modification as a separate patch we are assured that
the older style auth loading and the new one both work.

Change-Id: I72d81bd96b183d32697cbf259187ac0df13028c4

commit_message:
Use auth plugin for trustee

Create a new config section for configuring the user that trusts are
assigned to. This section should be configured like any other auth
plugin however it should not provide scoping information.

Closes-Bug: #1446918
DocImpact: Creates a new section 'trustee' that contains the credentials
           for the user that will receive delegated roles.
Change-Id: Idead7f505c41a55356f3670b322cbb831d442276
Co-Authored-By: Miguel Grinberg <miguel.grinberg@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Support use_autoconfig in sahara node group templates

Since 0.10.0 python-saharaclient has ability to specify
use_autoconfig parameter when creating node group templates.
This patch adds support for this feature to
OS::Sahara::NodeGroupTemplate resource in Heat.

Change-Id: I47121d00fd1fedf1f5805c84754cb8f6b509711d

commit_message:
Support volume_local_to_instance in sahara node group templates

Since 0.9.0 python-saharaclient has ability to specify
volume_local_to_instance parameter when creating node group templates.
This patch adds support for this feature to
OS::Sahara::NodeGroupTemplate resource in Heat.

Change-Id: I17ea492bfc32bf1d362b4dfd5c8cd84ef45eebab

As a follow-up to Ibfd54e7b1bae700e4fb49a32e5bf7c00d1f104d9,
moving all the scripts from bin/ to setuptools entry points.

commit_message:
Split engine service test cases (9)

This patch separates out the stack-update unit tests into a dedicated
module. Some mox calls are replaced with mock calls where appropriate.

Change-Id: I01793f4a4970fef49b935c6be07903b723d6126f

commit_message:
Remove iso8601 dependency

The parse_isotime() from oslo.utils does exactly that in a slightly
better way, so no need to use that one here.

Change-Id: I1bf7f60f2bf8e5848a2a1f3a2a55b6d379641900

commit_message:
Add an empty policy.d in UT to satisfy oslo_policy requirement

While running UT, oslo_policy automatically loads files in
policy.d.
If this directory doesn't exist, oslo_policy fails.

Change-Id: I37d76e2c48d23dcf964121ad0214f1f027aba2d8
Closes-bug: #1484553

commit_message:
Validate value when user update quota

Cinder currently doesn't check the existing resource
when user lowers the quota sets. It should have an optional
action that doesn't allow to update the quota of resources
lower than current usage.

This patch adds code to validate the update value of quota and
ensure the value can't be lower than existing resource.

APIImpact
Add an optional boolean argument 'skip_validation' with default value True.
{
  "quota_set": {xxxx},
  "skip_validation": 'True'/'False'
}
If skip_validation=False and the update value is lower than existing resource,
API will return 400 Bad Request.

Change-Id: I24428ce53e5d10e77235f372bb6d0b70ea672412
Closes-Bug: #1304234

commit_message:
Increase timeout for separate services tests

- Default timeout for os services to be ready
is 5 minutes that is not enough sometimes.
Increased that value to 15 minutes.

Change-Id: I649a9222e90bce9badd3fd904c60e4b9c528ebac
Closes-Bug: #1490629

commit_message:
Use database_user_create in Heat bootstrap

The register operation was using database_user which is also a global
variable in group_vars/all.yml. This results in Heat being undeployable
because database_user is overwritten.

Change-Id: I78b2db34b7c99142040390c7258b7e81d3770835
Closes-bug: #1491980

commit_message:
Fixed issue 1484502

OSTF test failes in dual hypervisor mode, because
when ostf test try to launch a instance it
random chooses from nova or vcenter
availability_zone.

-add param availability_zone in methods of creating servers and volume

Closes-bug:#1484502

Change-Id: Icf9f1775e2bfab1441b82ec32d68b318332d5aed

commit_message:
Allow arbitrary source archive name to be imported into Dockerfile

Currently we cannot import source archives with names different
than expected by hardcoded line in Dockerfiles. This worked well
for Openstack services' tarballs where we expected SERVICE-* root
folder after extraction or kanaka-noVNC for nova-novncproxy docker.
The latter fails if one tries to clone or get tarball under other
names. This fix allows any archive (tar,tgz,zip) or repo name to be
imported into dockerfile.

Change-Id: I869a6a19afaf0e93925572746c22b7589b6600c9
Closes-Bug: #1491415

commit_message:
[rpc] pull: removed a hack to avoid object backport triggered

Since oslo.versionedobjects 0.8.0, the object is not backported if the
requested version is the same as the latest known.

Change-Id: Ia1e9aa77b75261e4b2d2b24f31250ce2a2f028a7

commit_message:
Workaround for Manila gate failure

Instead of installing a tag novaclient we use the master
in git. This fix can be reverted if novaclient has a new version
tag.

Change-Id: I15ba39a18bd94fe818cc936b9763925384a72d0f
Partial-Bug: #1491262

This adds implementations for manage_existing_snapshot,
manage_existing_snapshot_get_size, and unmanage_snapshot for
PureFCDriver and PureISCSIDriver.

Similar to the implementation of the manage/unmanage volume these will
need a volume_ref containing a ‚Äòname‚Äô key and value that matches an
object in Purity. In this case it will need to be the full name of a
snapshot object.

Due to this requiring a rename of the snapshot it will only be available
if using Purity REST API v1.4 or greater. If using a lower version an
exception will be raised.

commit_message:
Implement manage/unmanage snapshot in Pure drivers

This adds implementations for manage_existing_snapshot,
manage_existing_snapshot_get_size, and unmanage_snapshot for
PureFCDriver and PureISCSIDriver.

Similar to the implementation of the manage/unmanage volume these will
need a volume_ref containing a ‚Äòname‚Äô key and value that matches an
object in Purity. In this case it will need to be the full name of a
snapshot object.

Due to this requiring a rename of the snapshot it will only be available
if using Purity REST API v1.4 or greater. If using a lower version an
exception will be raised.

Change-Id: Icb788e6cc0ee0e13393a12bc6aaccc57e1d491fd
Implements: blueprint pure-manage-snapshot

commit_message:
Enable py34 tests for pluggable ipam backend

Enable neutron.tests.unit.db.test_ipam_pluggable_backend.
It was disabled after extending ipam tests to run db_base_plugin tests,
which are not py34 compatible yet.

Change-Id: I3ae491fa79d4c3311a86e98db3fb2f7d5926a0ba

commit_message:
Redis Clustering Initial Implementation

Implements the CLI and python-API methods to support the
clustering commands, including the new cluster scaling
commands.

Change-Id: Icc9b4eea8ed7db1455692823d29586088cfc9434
Implements: blueprint redis-cluster

subject: Invert logic of counting in InstanceGroup _get_batches()
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4257, 'name': 'Zane Bitter', 'email': 'zbitter@redhat.com', 'username': 'zaneb'}, {'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 6577, 'name': 'Sergey Kraynev', 'email': 'sergejyit@gmail.com', 'username': 'skraynev'}, {'_account_id': 7385, 'name': 'Thomas Herve', 'email': 'therve@redhat.com', 'username': 'therve'}, {'_account_id': 8833, 'name': 'Rabi Mishra', 'email': 'ramishra@redhat.com', 'username': 'rabi'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-16 21:57:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Account for changing target capacity when batching rolling updates

If the size of a scaling group is changed at the same time as a rolling
update is initiated, there may actually be more members in service to count
toward the minimum than the algorithm takes into account (due to assuming
that the size never changes at the same time as the update). This change is
required to match the functionality of rolling updates in ResourceGroup,
though it may still be suboptimal in some scenarios.

Change-Id: I3c30a57eebb4040a2ca638e41975303e81eaa7f3
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-08-26 13:35:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Invert logic of counting in InstanceGroup _get_batches()

Count the number of members we have updated, not the number we have
remaining. This makes future refactoring slightly easier.

commit_message:
Invert logic of counting in InstanceGroup _get_batches()

Count the number of members we have updated, not the number we have
remaining. This makes future refactoring slightly easier.

Change-Id: I3c30a57eebb4040a2ca638e41975303e81eaa7f3
Partially-Implements: blueprint scaling-group-common

commit_message:
Allowing job binaries to be edited

Adding a table row option to be able to edit a given
job binary object.  Also adding a tests for the new
functionality.

Change-Id: I7733797d4ab5de0db731da7160437f60f8e5c214
Implements: bp allow-editing-of-job-binaries

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-27 01:14:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add support for MariaDB datastore in Trove

A specification for this change was submitted and reviewed in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/211330/

This patchset adds the hooks and configurations options required.
No operation has been reimplemented, MariaDB 5.5 behaves exactly
as MySQL 5.5. Because of this, this patchset depends on the MySQL
Manager Refactor, which makes it possible to the MariaDB driver to
inherit the implementation of the MySQL driver.

WIP: Unit tests
Implements blueprint mariadb-datastore-support

Change-Id: Ia1d77fee82b08b24f5f379ee1534f335db97fd57

commit_message:
Add support for MariaDB datastore in Trove

A specification for this change was submitted and reviewed in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/211330/

This patchset adds the hooks and configurations options required.
No operation has been reimplemented, MariaDB 5.5 behaves exactly
as MySQL 5.5. Because of this, this patchset depends on the MySQL
Manager Refactor, which makes it possible to the MariaDB driver to
inherit the implementation of the MySQL driver.

Implements blueprint mariadb-datastore-support

Change-Id: Ia1d77fee82b08b24f5f379ee1534f335db97fd57
Depends-On: I633273d438c22f98bef2fd1535730bcdb5e5cff0

commit_message:
MariaDB 5.5 image building scripts

Updates redstack script to support mariadb as a valid datastore.
Adds elements for MariaDB 5.5 for Ubuntu and Fedora.
Keeps the dependency with Percona XtraDB to handle backups and replication
in MariaDB 5.5.

Change-Id: I05ce0ce2f5f64f72413d4035b03d62111f89b784
Depends-On: I633273d438c22f98bef2fd1535730bcdb5e5cff0
Implements: blueprint mariadb-datastore-support

commit_message:
Add Redis backup/restore functionality

Performs backup using the Redis client to persist data to the file
system, then streams the result to swift.

Performs restore by replacing the data file with the Swift backup
and starting the server again in the correct manner.

Note: Running the int-tests require that volume_support is set
to false in the test.conf file.

To run:
./redstack install
./redstack kick-start redis
(vi /etc/trove/test.conf and change volume_support to false)
./redstack int-tests --group=backup (or --group=redis_supported)

Co-Authored-by: hardy.jung <hardy.jung@daumkakao.com>
Co-Authored-by: Peter Stachowski <peter@tesora.com>

Depends-On: I633273d438c22f98bef2fd1535730bcdb5e5cff0
Implements: blueprint redis-backup-restore
Change-Id: I1bd391f8e3f7de12396fb41000e3c55be23c04ee

commit_message:
Update from global requirements

Because the patch from the sync bot keeps auto-rebasing
and we need to get this in sooner than later.

This is really needed because we've landed code that requires
oslo.versionedobjects>=0.9.0 and are broken downstream without
that.

Change-Id: I4446b148472aa56be05346b80dc3c0add939a726

PyKMIP has released version 0.4.0. This new release provides an

is being used in Barbican by the KMIP secret store.

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Increase PyKMIP version to 0.4.0

PyKMIP has released version 0.4.0. This new release provides an
improved interface for communicating with a KMIP device. This release
is being used in Barbican by the KMIP secret store.

Change-Id: I744b4863ec05e4e96748f081fb1e369a1aea9e77

commit_message:
Add keystoneauth to global requirements

It seems that keystoneauth is very close to a 1.0 release and
in order for anyone to be able to use it, it needs to be in
the global requirements.

commit_message:
add a command note

The httpd service will not restart if it is already running,
which leads to the dashboard verify operation failed,
so add this note (rdo and obs version)

Change-Id: Ia4697531e8638d2a91e2f65d94aa7c55c4a6d4bb
Closes-Bug: #1490485

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-03 23:38:21.000000000', 'files': ['deliverables/liberty/python-novaclient.yaml'], 'message': 'Release python-novaclient 2.28.0

This is mostly needed for some key fixes once we deployed v2.0 on v2.1
with 8349aff5a and 4a18f7d3b which we should release before we close out
liberty.

The version is 2.28.0 rather than 2.27.1 because of 9b7dd38 which looks
like a feature that slipped in without a blueprint or bug.

Related-Bug: #1491579
Related-Bug: #1491325

Change-Id: I978e82a699b9f33898926c13332bb6461a0e4dae
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Release python-novaclient 2.28.0

This is mostly needed for some key fixes once we deployed v2.0 on v2.1
with 8349aff5a and 4a18f7d3b which we should release before we close out
liberty.

The version is 2.28.0 rather than 2.27.1 because of 9b7dd38 which looks
like a feature that slipped in without a blueprint or bug.

Related-Bug: #1491579
Related-Bug: #1491325

Change-Id: I978e82a699b9f33898926c13332bb6461a0e4dae

commit_message:
Update Barbican Gate to use new Devstack config

This will merge the experimental new-plugin job into the existing gate
job, removing the experimental job in the process as it was only for
testing these changes.

Change-Id: I39c9877a2e6dcb8b08c92f9ac51294ffb0d2f1db
Depends-On: I0ec63819b3aae21a6ffaed5cf8285e26dce6ae94

commit_message:
Adds instance_uuid index for instance_system_metadata

DB migrating script don't create index on
instance_system_metadata.instance_uuid for SQLite,
PostgreSQL and IBM DB, it cause the listing instances
have low performance. Adds instance_uuid index
for these DB.

Change-Id: I8a6425b00fe5f491b1bd98b7b335e7d8b13eaf33
Closes-Bug: #1480029

commit_message:
Use domain checking for user_role provider

Enforce domain name checking by using domain_check method.

Note: Implements the following user story:
62-keystone-v3-implement-support-for-default-domain-if-no-domain

Change-Id: I5fbcb2ee356703ef8f0166fb5c569cf975b9560b

commit_message:
Log and report trace on service operation fails

This patch adds exception logging to the swift service API. Each
operation that results in failure of any operation will now log
the exception as well as report a timestamp and full stack trace
in the results returned by the service API calls.

Change-Id: I7336b28354e7740ea7d048bdf355e3c1a1b4436c

commit_message:
Refactor InstanceGroup batch size check

Since we can now calculate the batch count externally, just pass that in.
Also, create an intermediate variable total_pause_time to eliminate
repitition and make the code a little more self-documenting.

Change-Id: Icceac0142055e7262985aa61a425d503c3929a42

Change-Id: I36db5e06f41de0977f1b29d6118b7a370c9f838b

commit_message:
Add methods for checking scoped tokens

Refactor _check_scoped_token_attributes so it doesn't check existence of
project or domain key in the token payload.
Add to methods _check_project_scoped_token_attributes and
_check_domain_scoped_token_attributes that compare present and expected
project and domain respectively. Also, those two methods use internally
_check_scoped_token_attributes for validating token input.

Change-Id: I36db5e06f41de0977f1b29d6118b7a370c9f838b

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-05 04:45:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix blacklist_file option exclude regex generation

This commit fixes the regex generation from the blacklist_file option.
Previously it was only generating an exclude regex (unless a regex was
also provided) this however wasn't working with testr. This was due
to how testr uses the regex certain regexes which just had the
lookahead exclude was not actually excluding the tests. However,
adding a real regex match fixes this issue. So this commit adds logic
to guess a regex that always matches to make the exclude portion work.
This is a hack until we can fix the testr regex filter logic to handle
just a lookahead exclude properly. (most likely need to change a
re.match to a re.search)

commit_message:
Fix blacklist_file option exclude regex generation

This commit fixes the regex generation from the blacklist_file option.
Previously it was only generating an exclude regex (unless a regex was
also provided) this however wasn't working with testr. This was due
to how testr uses the regex certain regexes which just had the
lookahead exclude was not actually excluding the tests. However,
adding a real regex match fixes this issue. So this commit adds logic
to guess a regex that always matches to make the exclude portion work.
This is a hack until we can fix the testr regex filter logic to handle
just a lookahead exclude properly. (most likely need to change a
re.match to a re.search)

Change-Id: Ic36aa1fd4b829c21f2ba74ced7dbf0dabbea6d10

", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
fix metadata for compute cpu notifications

currently,the cpu notifications has extremely verbose metadata which
is list of all metrics in message. ie, each meter has metadata like:

  u'metrics': [
       {'timestamp': u'2013-07-29T06:51:34.472416',
        'name': 'cpu.frequency', 'value': 1600,
        'source': 'libvirt.LibvirtDriver'},

       ...

       {'timestamp': u'2013-07-29T06:51:34.472416',
        'name': 'cpu.user.time', 'value': 17421440000000,
        'source': 'libvirt.LibvirtDriver'}],

    ...
    }

the original metadata pre-declarative notifications is:

    {'timestamp': u'2013-07-29T06:51:34.472416',
     'name': 'cpu.frequency',
     'value': 1600,
     'source': 'libvirt.LibvirtDriver',
     'event_type': 'compute.metrics.update',
     'host': <publisher_id>}

the proposed metadata removes all data already included in meter:

    {'source': 'libvirt.LibvirtDriver',
     'event_type': 'compute.metrics.update',
     'host': <publisher_id>}

Change-Id: I2c8d4ba7768cba378b931acbfe84a29549da7f8b

commit_message:
Update tag version to 11.2.1

The tag version - which is used for the repository folder
referenced when building/synchronising the wheels - was
mistakenly left at 11.1.2 for the 11.2.0 release.

This is a patch to update the tag for a fast follow release
of 11.2.1.

Change-Id: I11f141585af3f799528cd9146e41bf035ebdb099

commit_message:
Replaces print with print() for py 2/3 compatibility

This patch replaces print with print() to comply with
the newer python version i.e. python3.

Partially-Implements: Blueprint neutron-python3

Change-Id: Id92a7d292b832f07c79da8a42ac90b99d8c2c0cc

commit_message:
Enhanced error checking in get_discovery_url

get_discovery_url should never return an empty
URL. Added check and exception for this situation.

Co-Authored-By: Vilobh Meshram <vilobhmm@yahoo-inc.com>

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1491178
Change-Id: I2d5b3996c0ee53f40399ca3fd0d6b987daa26f79

commit_message:
Add test for Nova list-versions API

This commit adds a test that does a GET on the raw endpoint to
ensure that the nova version GET does the right thing.

Co-Authored-By: Ken'ichi Ohmichi <oomichi@mxs.nes.nec.co.jp>

Related-Bug: #1491579
Change-Id: I5ee09891cd1b62a87d25284be961c2027cdbd82a

datastore/datastore-version the datastore would be managed behind the
scenes. This means that when creating a datastore-version, a datastore
will be automatically created, if it does not already exist.

commit_message:
Implements Datastore Registration API

Adds the mgmt APIs for

1. Add a new datastore-version.
2. Reset the attributes of an existing datastore-version.
3. List datastore-versions.
4. Get details of a datastore-version.
5. Delete existing datastore-version.

In order to simplify the process of registering an image for a new
datastore/datastore-version the datastore would be managed behind the
scenes. This means that when creating a datastore-version, a datastore
will be automatically created, if it does not already exist.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint datastore-registration-api
Depends-On: I915baa4c5c8bbe3f0483bcaeaa5ce95044d35bf7
Change-Id: If79a03962abc41033dfe6e6ec1e335b243bb74f7

commit_message:
Implements Datastore Registration API

Adds the mgmt APIs for

1. Create datastore-version.
2. List datastore-versions.
3. Get details of a datastore-version.
4. Update the attributes of an existing datastore-version.
5. Delete a datastore-version.

Added the code to management.py and the unit-tests,
this code would help for writing integration tests to trove
for the newly added management-apis.

Change-Id: I915baa4c5c8bbe3f0483bcaeaa5ce95044d35bf7
Implements: blueprint datastore-registration-api

commit_message:
Remove Nova v3 version API schema

The commit Ia8e03aad49c524e5c3df110f0737eee3262b93e6 added a response
schema for Nova v3 version API. However the v3 API has been removed
but we forgot to remove it.
This patch removes it for the cleanup before adding the response
schema of Nova v2/v2.1 version API.

Change-Id: I5e96630fe9d4ae424df7064f4f759497c634f02c

commit_message:
objects: Hook migration object into Instance

Make sure we can access the migration context from the Instance object.
Also add some of the methods that will be used for manipulating the
migration context of the instance so as to avoid more than a single
version bump.

Change-Id: I52d7c13460fbb16dea107724da392df64f62bc51
Related-blueprint: migration-fix-resource-tracking

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-16 03:27:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Not pass secgroup values if not specified

Now Nova passes None to Neutron as security group values when clients
don't specify these values on "create a security group" API. That
causes Neutron returns a BadRequest response and the creation fails.

On Neutron's "create a security group" API, both name and description
are optional. So this patch adds type checks before getting values
without the existence checks.

In addition, if clients don't specify these values, this patch makes
Nova don't pass these values to Neutron without None. After that,
clients can create a security group without name and description like
Neutron ones.

Change-Id: I45c92d77c083838fbb7c5146e43c3b661e14c42d
Closes-Bug: #1460875

', 'number': 7}, {'created': '2015-06-16 23:37:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Not pass secgroup values if not specified

Now Nova passes None to Neutron as security group values when clients
don't specify these values on "create a security group" API. That
causes Neutron returns a BadRequest response and the creation fails.

On Neutron's "create a security group" API, both name and description
are optional. So this patch adds type checks before getting values
without the existence checks.

In addition, if clients don't specify these values, this patch makes
Nova don't pass these values to Neutron without None. After that,
clients can create a security group without name and description like
Neutron ones.

Change-Id: I45c92d77c083838fbb7c5146e43c3b661e14c42d
Closes-Bug: #1460875

commit_message:
Add secgroup param checks for Neutron

If using nova-network, "create a security group" API call fails
unless specifying name or description. On the other hand, if calling
Neutron API directly without Nova proxy, we can create a security
group without name or description.

This patch enforces to specify both name and description even if using
Neutron for consistent validation behavior between nova-network and
Neutron.

Change-Id: I45c92d77c083838fbb7c5146e43c3b661e14c42d
Closes-Bug: #1460875

commit_message:
List credentials by type

Currently the only attribute that you can filter a credential list by is
user_id. I want to be able to list by user_id and credential type (a
required field) so that I only get back my EC2 credentials (for example)
when I do a list.

Change-Id: I91f8fb15a2e9a8326059d7a60d2bf1b4c4aa6daa
Closes-bug: #1460492
bp list-credentials-by-type

commit_message:
filter pre_assigned_dev_names when finding disk dev

when finding disk dev we should filter pre_assigned_dev_names,
otherwise it returns the used dev name and then causing not creating
new disk dev.

Change-Id: I5f7ed979284c5e6e3569e9b503cb8c93c3e47ab3
Closes-Bug: #1471307

commit_message:
Add mechanism to limit Request ID size

Adding 'max_request_id_length' defaulting to 0 for backportability.

DocImpact
SecurityImpact

Closes-Bug: #1482301
Change-Id: Ie68afe7610a414bbcc42ff3bee33a9779303c115

commit_message:
Fix permission issue of server group API

Server group was created by tenantA, but it can
be shown and deleted by tenantB. Fix this permission
issue, and update test cases.

Change-Id: Ib0b96d536f7b085ef047cb8206de05f9bedc004f
Closes-Bug: #1466390

commit_message:
libvirt: enable live migration with serial console

When migrating an instance that uses serial console, the domain XML
must be changed to reflect the serial console configuration of the
target host.

Also prevent live migration when serial console is enabled and the
libvirt version is not able to process modified domain XML.

Change-Id: I654e444584124334e34d4673db6464cc2f2b822e
Partial-Bug: #1455252

commit_message:
deprecate db2 nosql driver

the db2 nosql product is not in development anymore as IBM has moved
on to an alternate solution. the existing driver code is untested
in the community and IBM products are moving off of it. this patch
marks db2 nosql driver for deprecation.

Closes-Bug: #1491819
Change-Id: Ic4e906615931143744f25d70935bdb8138a6b93a

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-16 03:41:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Neutron: Check port binding status

Neutron api creates/uses a port which the port vif_type is
'binding_failed' without any verification, this leads libvirt
driver failed to create instance, and cause vif driver raise
a wrong exception message when binding failed.
this patch addes a new exception PortBindingFailed to indicats
the port binding failed.
Closes-Bug: 1390336
Co-authored-by: Alex Xu <hejie.xu@intel.com>

Change-Id: I66763ff5293473d1283d55f76dfe33d153abaaec

driver failed to create instance, and cause vif driver raise

this patch addes a new exception PortBindingFailed to indicats

commit_message:
Neutron: Check port binding status

Neutron api creates/uses a port which the port vif_type is
'binding_failed' without any verification, this leads to libvirt
driver failing to create instance, and cause vif driver to raise
a wrong exception message.

This patch adds a new exception PortBindingFailed to indicate port binding
failed. If port is newly created, delete it if PortBindingFailed exception
catched.

Closes-Bug: #1390336
Change-Id: I66763ff5293473d1283d55f76dfe33d153abaaec

commit_message:
Fix hooks for dealing with member actions

This patch ensures that operations like add_router_interface
are correctly dispatched to the plugin.
It does so by introducing fairly ugly hacks in the
resource_identifier, and attribute_population pecan hooks.

This is however the best possible solution wiht the current
infrastructure which basically relies on hooks for request
dispatching.

Change-Id: I34880d1ce796cfd6f81d16fc1b9fd8387b5db056

commit_message:
Deprecate LDAP Resource Backend

Change 8ff5520713251ec247eeeb783f140d757cbdceb0
deprecated LDAP Assignment, which meant our
current Assignment + Resource backends. This was
officially deprecated in Kilo, however the deprecation
notice on resource was missed.

This change adds the missing bit: deprecate LDAP
Resource backend.

Closes-Bug: #1476347

Change-Id: Ie564f3a7dd586ced3aed72ad1eb57934e6911d4e

commit_message:
Remove errant } in create-zanata-xml for Horizon

This causes the Zanata CLI utility to print an error message about
accepted variables, and it may cause problems for the parser.

Change-Id: If46bd2baf8ee12394b61a9d505fd9f7e690f1b23

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4240, 'name': 'Craig Vyvial', 'email': 'cp16net@gmail.com', 'username': 'cp16net'}, {'_account_id': 5293, 'name': 'Nikhil', 'email': 'SlickNik@gmail.com', 'username': 'slicknik'}, {'_account_id': 6413, 'name': 'Victoria Martinez de la Cruz', 'email': 'victoria@redhat.com', 'username': 'vkmc'}, {'_account_id': 7806, 'name': 'Sushil Kumar', 'email': 'skm.net@gmail.com', 'username': 'sushilkm'}, {'_account_id': 10215, 'name': 'Peter Stachowski', 'email': 'peter@tesora.com', 'username': 'peterstac'}, {'_account_id': 12758, 'name': 'Masaki Matsushita', 'email': 'glass.saga@gmail.com', 'username': 'masaki'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-02 03:54:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix ubuntu image builds due to revert in tarball names

The format for the SHA256SUMS file was reverted so that they now refer to
the images using the release code name (e.g. trusty) as opposed to the
release version nomenclature (e.g. ubuntu 14.04). This is causing ubuntu
based image builds to fail. This reverts the fix which explicitly specifies
the release version name since this is no longer available.

Reverts: I36bfba75c22b0a153eda2fcc3137fcefa9a29536
Change-Id: I633273d438c22f98bef2fd1535730bcdb5e5cff0
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-09-03 03:10:48.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/functions_qemu'], 'message': 'Fix ubuntu image builds due to revert in tarball names

The format for the SHA256SUMS file was reverted so that they now refer to
the images using the release code name (e.g. trusty) as opposed to the
release version nomenclature (e.g. ubuntu 14.04). This is causing ubuntu
based image builds to fail. This reverts the fix which explicitly specifies
the release version name since this is no longer available.

Reverts: I36bfba75c22b0a153eda2fcc3137fcefa9a29536
Change-Id: I633273d438c22f98bef2fd1535730bcdb5e5cff0
Depends-On: Ie43bc969425795b5ba9e9ee988e0caa8e86ce354', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Fix ubuntu image builds due to revert in tarball names

The format for the SHA256SUMS file was reverted so that they now refer to
the images using the release code name (e.g. trusty) as opposed to the
release version nomenclature (e.g. ubuntu 14.04). This is causing ubuntu
based image builds to fail. This reverts the fix which explicitly specifies
the release version name since this is no longer available.

Reverts: I36bfba75c22b0a153eda2fcc3137fcefa9a29536
Change-Id: I633273d438c22f98bef2fd1535730bcdb5e5cff0
Depends-On: Ie43bc969425795b5ba9e9ee988e0caa8e86ce354

commit_message:
Requeuing event with workload_partitioning on publish failure

when workload_partitioning is enabled,
publishing of samples occurs in the
pipeline listeners. If publishing fails
when single publisher is configured, event
will not be requeued or ack'ed.

This fix requeues or acks the event based on
ack_on_event_error.

Change-Id: I8f2f889736c8897e5b15952ab32308cf33205c3f
Closes-Bug: 1488202

commit_message:
Add timeout to keystone requests

Our agent is timing out on getting keystone tokens and the
monasca url adding in the ability to set a timeout for these
requests

commit_message:
Deprecate create Discover without session

The comments indicated that creating a Discover without a
session is deprecated, but there was no warning generated.

Also, updated the Discover() parameter docstrings with the
standard deprecation info (e.g., in what release it's
deprecated and when we might remove it).

bp deprecations

Change-Id: I1d42b74aa72c15b95ac3c365b40d8c622869ed7e

commit_message:
workaround for RAX repose configuration

The RAX Repose environment is blocking access to the API version
information by local policy, returning a 401 before we even get to
Nova itself. While this in clearly incorrect behavior, it is behavior
in the field, and we should not break all our users on that cloud.

This catches the 401 and translates that so that it's the equivalent
of only supporting v2.0. We will be taking these API calls to defcore,
and intend to remove this work around once that is done.

Change-Id: I2072095c24b41efcfd58d6f25205bcc94f1174da
Related-Bug: #1491579

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-03 12:28:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Don't assume oscomputeversions is correctly deployed

The paste pipeline that's "above" the /v2/ and /v2.1/ urls is the
oscomputeversions dispatcher, which should provide 300 redirects to
versions in question. Previously the code that was trying to discover
information about the current version did so via a GET of something
that looked like /v2. On an upstream compatible OpenStack this
actually triggers a 300 and redirect to /v2/ for the real answer.

On deployed public clouds, oscomputeversions is sometimes not deployed
at all, or front end blocking by the load balancer does
weirdness. Sometimes with a 401, sometimes a hang.

This fixes the way that first request is made that should avoid the
300 redirect entirely. The code probably should have done this
originally, but it was tested with upstream configuration that worked
fine in this case.

This fix is tested against HP Cloud (the only pub cloud I have creds
with). Before this fix "nova list" hangs trying to get the supported
versions, after the fix it works as expected.

Change-Id: I1692380fe8d340e5c044f46dd0b103c7550d2c7d
Closes-Bug: #1491579

commit_message:
Don't assume oscomputeversions is correctly deployed

The paste pipeline that's "above" the /v2/ and /v2.1/ urls is the
oscomputeversions dispatcher, which should provide 300 redirects to
versions in question. Previously the code that was trying to discover
information about the current version did so via a GET of something
that looked like /v2. On an upstream compatible OpenStack this
actually triggers a 300 and redirect to /v2/ for the real answer.

On deployed public clouds, oscomputeversions is sometimes not deployed
at all, or front end blocking by the load balancer does
weirdness. Sometimes with a 401, sometimes a hang.

This fixes the way that first request is made that should avoid the
300 redirect entirely. The code probably should have done this
originally, but it was tested with upstream configuration that worked
fine in this case.

This fix is tested against HP Cloud (the only pub cloud I have creds
with). Before this fix "nova list" hangs trying to get the supported
versions, after the fix it works as expected.

Change-Id: I1692380fe8d340e5c044f46dd0b103c7550d2c7d
Closes-Bug: #1491579

commit_message:
hyperv: convert driver to use nova.objects.ImageMeta

Convert the hyperv driver and related files to make use of
the nova.objects.ImageMeta object. Where an image_meta
dict is passed in via the virt API, it is converted to
object form before being used.

Change-Id: I673cb728b57419f68c6369c5f0f3351cbe5f65bf

commit_message:
Convert identity defaults to keystone v3 api

At this point all our function calls should be using the V3 APIs anyway
so switch the authentication credentials to v3 compatible ones and
remove all the hacks we added to force v3 API calls.

Implements: bp keystonev3
Change-Id: If92d3e11b9a363454f77527783b6d25f4da9c249

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-11 10:43:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Implement TODO for version listing

Return a list of currently enabled API versions building
the response in the same way as it is done for the eventlet
WSGI API in order to ensure backward compatibility.

The only version listed is obviously 2.0, but the solution
devised in this patch allows version controller for self
declaring the version they implement.

This patch also replaces the use of _lookup when such method
is not strictly necessary.
To this aim, the minimum version of Pecan has been bumped to
1.0 as previouse releases did not support dots "." as valid
characters in URI path segments.

Change-Id: Ia748194b2c07a04a711d32ce8058a006e73621ef

commit_message:
Implement TODO for version listing

Return a list of currently enabled API versions building
the response in the same way as it is done for the eventlet
WSGI API in order to ensure backward compatibility.

The only version listed is obviously 2.0, but the solution
devised in this patch allows version controller for self
declaring the version they implement.

This patch also replaces the use of _lookup when such method
is not strictly necessary.
To this aim, the minimum version of Pecan has been bumped to
1.0 as previouse releases did not support dots "." as valid
characters in URI path segments.

Change-Id: Ia748194b2c07a04a711d32ce8058a006e73621ef

Mysql jdbc connector returns an Integer when querying period and period.
Drizzle jdbc connector returns a Long. Adding appropriate conversions.

commit_message:
Updates the node count key for all types of bay

By default the key to get node count is "number_of_minions"
which is not true for baymodels other than kubernetes
and it raises "KeyError" so that status of bay will not
be updated.

Closes-Bug: #1489725
Change-Id: I9f6a8ebbc26f501d54ef97937329845a12002d6c

[{'created': '2015-09-03 06:18:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'agent_ilo doesnt boot up the image

The boot and deploy interfaces are not yet implemented
in agent_ilo driver. The boot.clean_up_ramdisk should be
called only when the driver has the boot and deploy
implemented.

Closes bug: #1491704

Change-Id: I291ae426671e3c0289cc1264ae46cf3a9021b27f
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-09-03 07:41:55.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/agent.py', 'ironic/tests/drivers/test_agent.py'], 'message': 'agent_ilo fails to bring up instance

Since boot is a core interface, there is an attribute
task.driver.boot for every driver and hence hasattr
cannot be used to check if the driver has a boot
interface.  This commit fixes the coding error.

Closes bug: #1491704

Change-Id: I291ae426671e3c0289cc1264ae46cf3a9021b27f
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
agent_ilo fails to bring up instance

Since boot is a core interface, there is an attribute
task.driver.boot for every driver and hence hasattr
cannot be used to check if the driver has a boot
interface.  This commit fixes the coding error.

Closes bug: #1491704

Change-Id: I291ae426671e3c0289cc1264ae46cf3a9021b27f

access to the automaton provided 'is_actionable_event'
method that provides an equivalent api.

commit_message:
Set correct tenant id when python-client init

If tenant name with chinese characters, an
'UnicodeEncodeError' exception raised when the tenant
creating a stack with a nova server. To set correct
tenant id instead of tenant name when novaclient init
is the best way to avoid this problem.

Also this patch fix this problem for glanceclient and
cinderclient.

Change-Id: Ifc8ab70c69453344156d25aba4291769bb7fe117
Closes-Bug: #1488881

commit_message:
initial python monasca-common code in monasca_common

This is the start of a python monasca-common package.
Initially it has a common python logging config,
common oslo opts, and mysql common code.

Change-Id: I15c32b72fc42a8c5ce9eeedf20ca3a11907bf29f

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-30 23:41:33.000000000', 'files': ['monascaclient/common/http.py'], 'message': 'Obfuscate Token in Debug Mode

Our client prints out the users token in each curl request.
These debug statements than get passed up to our other services
that use the client if on debug mode so we could be printing the
token in log files. We needed to remove that.

Change-Id: I6dd6c0f171f03f6715abd59b26e9f59de5b0bb9b
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Obfuscate Token in Debug Mode

Our client prints out the users token in each curl request.
These debug statements than get passed up to our other services
that use the client if on debug mode so we could be printing the
token in log files. We needed to remove that.

Change-Id: I6dd6c0f171f03f6715abd59b26e9f59de5b0bb9b

commit_message:
Add a session cache of can_access call results

This patch adds a decorator and function to all horizon components so
that the results of calls to can_access are cached in the session. This
should prevent large numbers of calls to APIs when can_access functions
need to get information from services. The cache is stored in
session['allowed'] using self.__class__ as the key, this ensures each
key is human readable and can be easily mocked out in future tests.

Change-Id: Ic65e4cb6499ecae4b09dd525416656a6f41853f5
Closes-Bug: 1367716

commit_message:
scenario001: deploy Nova

This patch deploy Nova:
* RabbitMQ, MySQL and Keystone resources
* Common nova service bits
* API, scheduler, conductor, console, compute (with qemu), cert, client,
  consoleauth, vncpoxy, neutron parameters
* Neutron configuration to talk to Nova API
* neutron_metadata_proxy_shared_secret parameter to talk to neutron
  metadata proxy

Change-Id: I9d46ba69df624a372abb84e22b1e8e28c84e23a7

commit_message:
scenario001: deploy Neutron

Deploy Neutron service and resources (rabbitmq user, mysql database,
keystone resources).
It will deploy:
* Neutron Server using ML2 / OVS plugin
* Neutron Agent using ML2 / OVS agent
* Neutron L3 & DHCP & Metering & Metadata & LBaaS agents

Change-Id: Ic799386a27c711b6f26e50279704e67cad6faccd

commit_message:
Use proper href attribute from vswitch object

This change is to use related_href property of vswitch
rather than href.  This way, comparisons in other objects
using vswitch_uri will match.

Change-Id: I22f78e6d14e1f2a796179066115bb1a7ed784563
Closes-Bug: 1492017

commit_message:
Adding documentation

This adds documentation for Bandit and all plugins, in RST format.
To build the new documentation you can use the new tox target:

  tox -e docs

This will spit out various formatted output into the docs/build
folder.

Change-Id: I012b5e321fad81e6064044745c8e7cb0c5e1b6ac
Closes-Bug: 1474796

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 11716, 'name': 'Tim Kelsey', 'email': 'timothy.kelsey@uk.ibm.com', 'username': 'tkelsey'}, {'_account_id': 11861, 'name': 'Travis McPeak', 'email': 'tmcpeak@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'travis-mcpeak'}, {'_account_id': 12000, 'name': 'Ian Cordasco', 'email': 'sigmavirus24@gmail.com', 'username': 'sigmavirus24'}, {'_account_id': 15304, 'name': 'Dave Belcher', 'email': 'dave.belcher@hp.com', 'username': 'hpbelch'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-22 16:00:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Added additional scope functions to StatementBuffer

I have made some changes to add additional scope awareness to the
StatementBuffer class. Additional functions have been added to allow
you to retrieve the lines of the parent of a given line, or all
children of a given line. Used in combination, it is possible to
retrieve all siblings of a given line.

StatementBuffer also now holds an archive of the AST of every statement
in it's unaltered state, which can be accessed using the new get_node
function, for example calling get_node(get_parent(line_no)) will
return the parent node of the given line, which includes the AST
of that node and all child nodes. Note, all the new functions take
a line number as a parameter, and return line numbers, or an AST
node for get_node().

Read the code for more info, or contact dave.belcher@hp.com for help

Change-Id: I2b0a6910fde06a8d02ea7878e1552719640302b2

commit_message:
Added additional scope functions to StatementBuffer

I have made some changes to add additional scope awareness to the
StatementBuffer class. Additional functions have been added to allow
you to retrieve the lines of the parent of a given line, or all
children of a given line. Used in combination, it is possible to
retrieve all siblings of a given line.

StatementBuffer also now holds an archive of the AST of every statement
in it's unaltered state, which can be accessed using the new get_node
function, for example calling get_node(get_parent(line_no)) will
return the parent node of the given line, which includes the AST
of that node and all child nodes. Note, all the new functions take
a line number as a parameter, and return line numbers, or an AST
node for get_node().

Read the code for more info, or contact dave.belcher@hp.com for help

Change-Id: I2b0a6910fde06a8d02ea7878e1552719640302b2

commit_message:
Remove Gemfile.lock for experimental puppet unit-test

Make sure any existing Gemfile.lock files are removed before running
bundler again.

Change-Id: I01b20adcaf712681d0b1e274a0b34389179e307a

commit_message:
Initial stab at pbr and version passing.

This patch updates the build system to use pbr. It also
passes the Horizon and App Catalog UI plugin versions
to the application repository as part of the ajax request
so we can more easily determine when v1 api support can
be removed in the future.

Change-Id: Ic407d45a09b00d97ff7492b6597693524522153d

commit_message:
Avoid returning volume metadata in DotHill driver

DotHill driver returns volume metadata on create volume.
It is not needed and causing CI failures.

Change-Id: Idbe16fcff60ed0c3cfa1f4ba66ca549c6dd9a1d8
Closes-Bug: #1487165
Co-Authored-By: Lakshman <lakshminarayanat@vedams.com>

First stab at Murano support. Supports plugin autodetection,
importing Packages and Bundles, installation detection
and launch support.

commit_message:
Add Keystone User/Group RoleAssignment resources

This is the second patch of two to allow roles to be added to existing
users. This patch adds two new resources:

  OS::Keystone::UserRoleAssignment
  OS::Keystone::GroupRoleAssignment

These resources will grant a user or group role(s) within the given
project or domain.

Change-Id: I4002fc245b1b21d99d95740b7d15642fd8f9e26d
Closes-Bug: #1477218

subject: Make RoleAssigment class to RoleAssigmentMixin class
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4715, 'name': 'Angus Salkeld', 'email': 'asalkeld@redhat.com', 'username': 'asalkeld'}, {'_account_id': 6577, 'name': 'Sergey Kraynev', 'email': 'sergejyit@gmail.com', 'username': 'skraynev'}, {'_account_id': 7385, 'name': 'Thomas Herve', 'email': 'therve@redhat.com', 'username': 'therve'}, {'_account_id': 9542, 'name': 'Pavlo Shchelokovskyy', 'email': 'pshchelokovskyy@mirantis.com', 'username': 'pshchelo'}, {'_account_id': 9751, 'name': 'IBM DB2 CI', 'email': 'scecd@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibmdb2', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11832, 'name': 'Bryan Jones', 'email': 'jonesbr@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'jonesbr'}, {'_account_id': 12321, 'name': 'Ryan Brown', 'email': 'rybrown@redhat.com', 'username': 'ryansb'}, {'_account_id': 14676, 'name': 'Kairat Kushaev', 'email': 'kkushaev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'kairat_kushaev'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-07 10:10:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Rename confusing handle_* methods

RoleAssigment class is inherited from Resource and re-write base
handle_* methods. However this resource has not mapping and it's not
used as complete resource, mostly as mixin class for Groups and User
keystone resources.

This method re-name handle_* methods, because this class is not resource
and it's not necessary use this official methods. Also these methods are
called directly instead of using common create/update/delete methods of
Resource class.

Furthermore using these official names is incorrect with current bunch
of parameters, which are not correspond official signature.

Change-Id: I67c1205406647b89c7c61097fa4dc5f4a463d9f8
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-08-10 11:46:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Make RoleAssigment class to RoleAssigmentMixin class

Functionality defined in RoleAssigment class is used only in another classes.
This patch makes RoleAssigment to RoleAssigmentMixin class:
 - was removed inheritance from Resource class
 - function names were updated to remove any relationships with Resource
   base methods
 - properties schema was moved out from class
 - validate method was renamed and disctributes for other resources,
   which are inherited from RoleAssigmentMixin
 - corresponding inherited resources and tests were updated

Change-Id: I67c1205406647b89c7c61097fa4dc5f4a463d9f8
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-08-11 13:19:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Make RoleAssigment class to RoleAssigmentMixin class

Functionality defined in RoleAssigment class is used only in another classes.
This patch makes RoleAssigment to RoleAssigmentMixin class:
 - was removed inheritance from Resource class

commit_message:
Make RoleAssigment class to RoleAssigmentMixin class

Functionality defined in RoleAssigment class is used only in another classes.
This patch makes RoleAssigment to RoleAssigmentMixin class:
 - was removed inheritance from Resource class
 - function names were updated to remove any relationships with Resource
   base methods
 - properties schema was moved out from class
 - validate method was renamed and disctributes for other resources,
   which are inherited from RoleAssigmentMixin
 - corresponding inherited resources and tests were updated

Change-Id: I67c1205406647b89c7c61097fa4dc5f4a463d9f8

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-19 21:49:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "allow configurable pipeline partitioning

existing code will create queues from the cartesian product of the
set of pipelines and the set of agents. these queues are identified
by pipe_type-pipe_name-agent_id. the problem arises where if an agent
dies, any messages left on it's queue will be lost as agent_id's tend
to be unique.

this patch changes the logic so rather than using the number of agents
as the set we build our cartesian product from, we use a set of numbers
of a configurable size. by default, it will be a set of 10 so that queues
are created from the product set of the set of pipelines and the set
{0, 1, 2, 3, ... 9}. similarly, the pipelines queues will be identified
by pipe_type-pipe_name-x, where x is value from numerical set. this
way, if an agent dies, the queues are still known and can be
redistributed and processed among the active agents.

Change-Id: I35e3afdd2c9f97ab5bc6bb89531bd20308c5f8c0
Closes-Bug: #1486754

commit_message:
allow configurable pipeline partitioning

existing code will create queues from the cartesian product of the
set of pipelines and the set of agents. these queues are identified
by pipe_type-pipe_name-agent_id. the problem arises where if an agent
dies, any messages left on it's queue will be lost as agent_id's tend
to be unique.

this patch changes the logic so rather than using the number of agents
as the set we build our cartesian product from, we use a set of numbers
of a configurable size. by default, it will be a set of 10 so that queues
are created from the product set of the set of pipelines and the set
{0, 1, 2, 3, ... 9}. similarly, the pipelines queues will be identified
by pipe_type-pipe_name-x, where x is value from numerical set. this
way, if an agent dies, the queues are still known and can be
redistributed and processed among the active agents.

Change-Id: I35e3afdd2c9f97ab5bc6bb89531bd20308c5f8c0
Closes-Bug: #1486754

commit_message:
Add support for drizzle jdbc connector

Mysql jdbc connector returns an Integer when querying period and period.
Drizzle jdbc connector returns a Long. Adding appropriate conversions
that are used by monasca-api and monasca-thresh.

Change-Id: I4282b7de3fcbd82b3196bce1b4379076eff60bbc

[WIP] Initial work for multinode support

This is dependant on zuulv3 support, so lets mock some of that for now.  We be
using ansiable to handle orchestration.

commit_message:
fix novaclient functional tests for new devstack config

The novaclient functional tests assumed computev21 as a type in the
service catalog. We're defaulting compute in devstack to v21 now, so
this no longer works. This is probably far too coupled to devstack
atm, however until we get to unversioned service catalog, this is what
we need to do.

Change-Id: Ifb0056924b20f62d75d13a7b4aae829df61a5396

commit_message:
Dropped release name from migration branch labels

Since the plan is to attach first Mitaka scripts to Liberty branches
with down_revision, and since labels are inherited from all other
revisions in the chain, using release names in branch labels would mean
that the following commands would be valid:

neutron-db-manage upgrade liberty_expand@<some_revision_from_mitaka>
neutron-db-manage upgrade mitaka_expand@<some_revision_from_liberty>

which may be confusing to users.

So let's drop release names from branch labels and use expand@head and
contract@head to access latest migrations.

Change-Id: Id524d7673ad248c831f6dbb3a6f2f3c50094acae
Partially-Implements: blueprint online-schema-migrations

subject: Fixing haproxy-playbook fails when installing on multiple hosts
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6816, 'name': 'Jesse Pretorius', 'email': 'jesse@odyssey4.me', 'username': 'jesse-pretorius'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-03 11:14:15.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/haproxy_server/tasks/haproxy_install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/haproxy_server/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/group_vars/hosts.yml', 'playbooks/roles/haproxy_server/tasks/haproxy_post_install.yml'], 'message': "Fixing haproxy-playbook fails when installing on multiple hosts

This bug is triggered when haproxy is deployed on multiple hosts
and external_lb_vip is different than the internal one.
As all host receive the same configuration, and are expected
to restart the haproxy service more than once
(once during role and once post_tasks), the playbook will fail,
because the restart of the service fails. The restart of the
service fails on some hosts because haproxy tries to
start/bind to an ip the host doesn't have (avoiding ip conflicts)

This allows haproxy to bind on non_local addresses by
addng a sysctl change in the playbook: net.ipv4.ip_nonlocal_bind = 1
The sysctl is changed for the containers/systems
when external_lb_vip is different than internal address and
the number of haproxy hosts is more than one thanks to a group_var.

Side-effect: other services are able to bind on non-local addresses
if the sysctl is changed.

This could be overriden by setting the variable haproxy_bind_on_non_local
in your user_* variables. If set to false, then the ip_non_local_bind
sysctl won't be changed.

Closes-Bug: #1487409

Change-Id: I41b3a5a4ba2d48192b505e3720456a77484aa92b
(cherry picked from commit 9df04fed70eb9f9e84f6da2ac5bb4d94df037fe6)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fixing haproxy-playbook fails when installing on multiple hosts

This bug is triggered when haproxy is deployed on multiple hosts
and external_lb_vip is different than the internal one.
As all host receive the same configuration, and are expected
to restart the haproxy service more than once
(once during role and once post_tasks), the playbook will fail,
because the restart of the service fails. The restart of the
service fails on some hosts because haproxy tries to
start/bind to an ip the host doesn't have (avoiding ip conflicts)

This allows haproxy to bind on non_local addresses by
addng a sysctl change in the playbook: net.ipv4.ip_nonlocal_bind = 1
The sysctl is changed for the containers/systems
when external_lb_vip is different than internal address and
the number of haproxy hosts is more than one thanks to a group_var.

Side-effect: other services are able to bind on non-local addresses
if the sysctl is changed.

This could be overriden by setting the variable haproxy_bind_on_non_local
in your user_* variables. If set to false, then the ip_non_local_bind
sysctl won't be changed.

Closes-Bug: #1487409

Change-Id: I41b3a5a4ba2d48192b505e3720456a77484aa92b
(cherry picked from commit 9df04fed70eb9f9e84f6da2ac5bb4d94df037fe6)

Application code shouldn't be calling sys.exit since it prevents the
caller from being able to continue if it wants and it makes unit

", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-09-03 19:38:36.000000000', 'files': ['bandit/core/config.py', 'tests/unit/core/test_config.py', 'bandit/bandit.py', 'bandit/core/utils.py'], 'message': "Raise exceptions from BanditConfig rather than exit

caller from being able to continue if it wants and it makes unit

Change-Id: I12e46ba564912ba2b55f18bbe5b5b6c81f6d7c78
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Raise exceptions from BanditConfig rather than exit

Application code shouldn't be calling sys.exit since it prevents the
caller from being able to continue if it wants and it makes unit
testing more difficult. Raise an exception instead.

Change-Id: I12e46ba564912ba2b55f18bbe5b5b6c81f6d7c78

commit_message:
Add driver and driver_info fields to Port

This will allow the network providers change to specify the networks
driver by port, rather than as a config option for all nodes managed by
a conductor. It will also allow for metadata used by the networks driver
to be placed in driver_info, such as switchport and switch ID for the
neutron_plugin driver.

Change-Id: I7229c4797ce3776592b1f3625552ba5963b26389
Implements: blueprint network-provider

commit_message:
Activate pep8 check that _ is imported

Remove the specification in tox.ini that _ is a builtin so that
it will no longer assume that _ does not need to be imported.
This helps ensure that the _ from i18n is used.

Activating this check did not flag any violations.

Change-Id: I1f156dbcd17b32c43c23731161d76ed2904f187f

The snmp declarative hardware pollster loads the metric definition from
a special yaml file and can poll those metrics. This enables the
developers to modify the yaml file only to add new snmp metrics without
writing any new python code.

This pollster doesn't get registered temporarily to avoid duplicating
samples. Will be registered in the following patches when old snmp
pollsters are deleted.

Implements: bp/declarative-snmp-metrics

commit_message:
Added snmp declarative hardware pollster

The snmp declarative hardware pollster loads the metric definition from
a special yaml file and can poll those metrics. This enables the
developers to modify the yaml file only to add new snmp metrics without
writing any new python code.

Added a new classmethod interface build_pollsters for PollsterBase. The
pollster plugin which implements this interface should return a list of
tuple (name, pollster), where name is the meter name it will return, and
pollster is the pollster object instances. All the pollsters returned by
this would be wrapped in stevedore extensions in
PollsterBase.get_pollster_extensions().

This pollster doesn't get registered temporarily to avoid duplicating
samples. Will be registered in the following patches when old snmp
pollsters are deleted.

Implements: blueprint declarative-snmp-metrics

Change-Id: I5abbe704cc08ea84aacf742eda7cee215141c3bb

commit_message:
Added CORS support to Keystone

This adds the CORS support middleware to Keystone, allowing a deployer
to optionally configure rules under which a javascript client may
break the single-origin policy and access the API directly. Included
are Keystone's auth headers, so that anyone activating this
middleware does not have to explicitly enable them.

OpenStack CrossProject Spec:
   http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-specs/specs/cors-support.html
Oslo_Middleware Docs:
   http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.middleware/cors.html
OpenStack Cloud Admin Guide:
   http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide-cloud/cross_project_cors.html

Change-Id: If58ad7d952ace9211f0ed8beff8552c216262382

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-27 18:21:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "MappingNotFound should be a UnexpectedError

The client shouldn't see a MappingNotFound error when they have an
incorrect mapping.  This is a security issue and is the result of a
incorrect server configuration.  We fix this issue by making the
error more ambiguous to the client, throwing a 'UnexpectedError'
instead.

We also updated test cases that expected a '404 Not Found' error
instead of a '500 Internal Server Error'.

Change-Id: I543907b403c20f39cea152474b95e675deb1a46a
Co-Authored-By: Christopher J. Schaefer <cjschaef@us.ibm.com>
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-08-27 20:15:40.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_federation.py', 'keystone/contrib/federation/backends/sql.py'], 'message': "MappingNotFound should be a UnexpectedError

The client shouldn't see a MappingNotFound error when they have an
incorrect mapping.  This is a security issue and is releasing too much information to the client. We fix this issue by making the
error more ambiguous, throwing a 'UnexpectedError'
instead.

We also updated test cases that expected a '404 Not Found' error
instead of a '500 Internal Server Error'.

Change-Id: I543907b403c20f39cea152474b95e675deb1a46a
Co-Authored-By: Christopher J. Schaefer <cjschaef@us.ibm.com>

commit_message:
MappingNotFound should be a UnexpectedError

The client shouldn't see a MappingNotFound error when they have an
incorrect mapping.  This is a security issue and is releasing too much information to the client. We fix this issue by making the
error more ambiguous, throwing a 'UnexpectedError'
instead.

We also updated test cases that expected a '404 Not Found' error
instead of a '500 Internal Server Error'.

Change-Id: I543907b403c20f39cea152474b95e675deb1a46a
Co-Authored-By: Christopher J. Schaefer <cjschaef@us.ibm.com>

instance anyways.

[{'created': '2015-09-03 06:15:06.000000000', 'files': ['doc/config-reference/compute/section_compute-scheduler.xml'], 'message': "Added note about multiple values for some filters

The aggregate_image_properties_isolation and aggregate_instance_extra_specs
filters are capable of accepting multiple values as a comma-separated list.
This change specifies that in the documentation. Note that the original bug
touches two other filters as well (aggregate_multitenancy_isolation_filter
and availability_zone_filter), however these aren't mentioned in this book.

commit_message:
Added note about multiple values for some filters

The aggregate_image_properties_isolation and aggregate_instance_extra_specs
filters are capable of accepting multiple values as a comma-separated list.
This change specifies that in the documentation. Note that the original bug
touches two other filters as well (aggregate_multitenancy_isolation_filter
and availability_zone_filter), however these aren't mentioned in this book.

Change-Id: If2a3f0757fde2e63a86f5c212579d78f4113ea0e
Closes-Bug: 1427706

commit_message:
Return multiple iSCSI portals in VNX Cinder driver

Return multiple iSCSI portals (using keys target_portals, target_iqns
and target_luns) in VNX Cinder driver whether the multipath option
is used or not. A single portal is continuously being returned in
target_portal, target_iqn and target_lun for drivers other than
libvirt driver.

Change-Id: Ibfd989d10a65a3b87647f3d7a4ff3596d822eec9
Closes-Bug: #1482017

commit_message:
Add experimental puppet-unit job for single node

Here we are adding a experimental job to loop over all our puppet-unit
specs on a single host. We can do this, because we are sandboxing all
our gems into local directories.

Change-Id: I1c32f8dd7e03ef883d4e88cadf488b3f51eeddca
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Added the support of Glance Artifact Repository

This patch adds a support of 'Murano Package' Glance artifact type to
the murano client. The ArtifactRepo class wraps the standard Glance's
V3 client and provides access to Glance Artifacts as to Murano
Packages.
Another class, called PackageManagerAdapter provides a temporary
facade which makes artifact-based packages compatible with the legacy
packages.

Depends-on: I11efa3758cea5eb459a101d62c93355f34bb42f9
Change-Id: I35d71bb7c03b23b01722e060c3ef770a24168ada
Implements-Blueprint: artifact-repository-support

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-08-27 10:31:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Glance MuranoPackage Artifact

Adds an artifact type for Glance V3 to define murano package, its
specific properties and binary objects (full package, logo and a ui
definition).

As a temporary workaround to simplify search a 'keywords' field is added
to contain display name and tags word-by-word, so any of them may be
used to locate a package. This will be ineffecient in terms of DB
performance, but at least not worse then the legacy solution.

Change-Id: I11efa3758cea5eb459a101d62c93355f34bb42f9

commit_message:
Glance MuranoPackage Artifact

Adds an artifact type for Glance V3 to define murano package, its
specific properties and binary objects (full package, logo and a ui
definition).

As a temporary workaround to simplify search a 'keywords' field is added
to contain display name and tags word-by-word, so any of them may be
used to locate a package. This will be inefficient in terms of DB
performance, but at least not worse then the legacy solution.

Implements-blueprint: artifact-repository-support
Change-Id: I11efa3758cea5eb459a101d62c93355f34bb42f9

commit_message:
Don't use positional for keypair loaded

This may cause problems in the future using a positional
parameter here if the order changes.

Change-Id: I9f37620b2f12453d86bddbb631ae3f0b8eb30580

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 11029, 'name': 'Jamie Finnigan', 'email': 'jamiefinnigan@gmail.com', 'username': 'jamiefinnigan'}, {'_account_id': 11716, 'name': 'Tim Kelsey', 'email': 'timothy.kelsey@uk.ibm.com', 'username': 'tkelsey'}, {'_account_id': 11861, 'name': 'Travis McPeak', 'email': 'tmcpeak@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'travis-mcpeak'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-03 01:06:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Introduce wildcards to blacklist_calls plugin

This change makes it so wildcards can be used in bandit.yaml when
configuring function calls that should be alerted on.  For example, it
allows 'telnetlib.*' to be set as a blacklist entry, and will then
alert on a call to telnetlib.Telnet() and any other functions in that
namespace.

It uses stdlib's fnmatch, which means the wildcards are Unix shell
style.

This change also hijacks the telnetlib import check, adding a wildcarded
blacklist calls check as described above and adjusting tests and
example naming accordingly.

Change-Id: I0ff5891282ab762fd3dfc0447b20028d81d9afef

commit_message:
Introduce wildcards to blacklist_calls plugin

This change makes it so wildcards can be used in bandit.yaml when
configuring function calls that should be alerted on.  For example, it
allows 'telnetlib.*' to be set as a blacklist entry, and will then
alert on a call to telnetlib.Telnet() and any other functions in that
namespace.

It uses stdlib's fnmatch, which means the wildcards are Unix shell
style.

This change also hijacks the telnetlib import check, adding a wildcarded
blacklist calls check as described above and adjusting tests and
example naming accordingly.

Change-Id: I0ff5891282ab762fd3dfc0447b20028d81d9afef

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-11 11:17:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add user_id,project_id traits to audit events

The ceilometer audit events currently don't have user/project
information associated with it. This is required to apply RBAC.
This changeset will add user_id and project_id traits to the
audit events namely *.http.*

Change-Id: If4034342c4e60d519f0ec96ae8895dcf78f8ad3b
blueprint: events-rbac
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-08-11 13:06:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add user_id,project_id traits to audit events

The ceilometer audit events currently don't have user/project
information associated with it. This is required to apply RBAC.
This changeset will add user_id and project_id traits to the
audit events namely *.http.*

Change-Id: If4034342c4e60d519f0ec96ae8895dcf78f8ad3b
blueprint: events-rbac
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-08-13 12:06:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add user_id,project_id traits to audit events

The ceilometer audit events stored at the ceilometer database
currently don't have user_id/project_id associated with them
even though this information is available as part of the event
message payload. The user_id and project_id information has to
be stored as traits so that there's user/project context for each
event and these traits are required to apply RBAC-based rules
and filters on events. For eg., presence of these traits enable
db queries - like get all events for a project/user against events
The audit event definition in the events yaml file already stores
payload.initiator.id as initiator_id but the initiator_id trait
is not a common trait across all events and thus this trait cannot
be used to apply RBAC filter against events.This changeset will
thus add user_id and project_id traits to the audit events namely
*.http.*

Change-Id: If4034342c4e60d519f0ec96ae8895dcf78f8ad3b
blueprint: events-rbac
", 'number': 3}, {'created': '2015-08-13 14:12:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add user_id,project_id traits to audit events

The ceilometer audit events stored at the ceilometer database
currently don't have user_id/project_id associated with them
even though this information is available as part of the event
message payload. The user_id and project_id information has to
be stored as traits so that there's user/project context for each
event and these traits are required to apply RBAC-based rules
and filters on events. For eg., presence of these traits enable
db queries - like get all events for a project/user against events
The audit event definition in the events yaml file already stores
payload.initiator.id as initiator_id but the initiator_id trait
is not a common trait across all events and thus this trait cannot
be used to apply RBAC filter against events.This changeset will
thus add user_id and project_id traits to the audit events namely
*.http.*

Change-Id: If4034342c4e60d519f0ec96ae8895dcf78f8ad3b
blueprint: events-rbac
", 'number': 4}, {'created': '2015-08-25 11:56:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add user_id,project_id traits to audit events

The ceilometer audit events stored at the ceilometer database
currently don't have user_id/project_id associated with them
even though this information is available as part of the event
message payload. The user_id and project_id information has to
be stored as traits so that there's user/project context for each
event and these traits are required to apply RBAC-based rules
and filters on events. For eg., presence of these traits enable
db queries - like get all events for a project/user against events.
The audit event definition in the events yaml file already stores
payload.initiator.id as initiator_id but the initiator_id trait
is not a common trait across all events and thus this trait cannot
be used to apply RBAC filter against events.This changeset will
thus add user_id and project_id traits to the audit events namely
*.http.* and add useri_id and project_id as default traits for all
events.

Change-Id: If4034342c4e60d519f0ec96ae8895dcf78f8ad3b
blueprint: events-rbac

payload.initiator.id as initiator_id but the initiator_id trait
is not a common trait across all events and thus this trait cannot
be used to apply RBAC filter against events.This changeset will
thus add user_id and project_id traits to the audit events namely
*.http.* and add useri_id and project_id as default traits for all
events.

DocImpact

commit_message:
Add user_id,project_id traits to audit events

The ceilometer audit events stored at the ceilometer database
currently don't have user_id/project_id associated with them
even though this information is available as part of the event
message payload. The user_id and project_id information has to
be stored as traits so that there's user/project context for each
event and these traits are required to apply RBAC-based rules
and filters on events. For eg., presence of these traits enable
db queries - like get all events for a project/user against events.
The audit event definition in the events yaml file already stores
payload.initiator.id as initiator_id but the initiator_id trait
is not a common trait across all events and thus this trait cannot
be used to apply RBAC filter against events.This changeset will
thus add user_id and project_id traits to the audit events namely
*.http.* and add useri_id and project_id as default traits for all
events.

DocImpact

Change-Id: If4034342c4e60d519f0ec96ae8895dcf78f8ad3b
blueprint: events-rbac

commit_message:
Implement tox.ini config for bashate and pep8 tests

This patch implements tox.ini configuration for bashate and pep8
tests for the purpose of implementing the standard openstack-infra
tests for these.

Change-Id: I72623ea3d531614a803f6b97a9f61f56c376c723
Implements: blueprint gate-split
(cherry picked from commit f82a179de108836f16a3b80b826a81a2a3b966ad)

subject: Update how neutron migrations are handled
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6816, 'name': 'Jesse Pretorius', 'email': 'jesse@odyssey4.me', 'username': 'jesse-pretorius'}, {'_account_id': 7307, 'name': 'Matt Thompson', 'email': 'mattt@defunct.ca', 'username': 'mattt416'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 9515, 'name': 'Matthew Kassawara', 'email': 'mkassawara@gmail.com', 'username': 'ionosphere80'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-21 11:26:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "[WIP] Update how neutron migrations are handled

We're seeing some neutron db sync failures in master branch (liberty).
It looks like there may be a few issues with the way we're handling
migrations:

1. We're not capturing the correct information in the 'Check last DB
   revision' task as the first line returned by 'neutron-db-manage
   history' is a header (this also means that the 'Inspect on disk
   neutron DB revision' task will never do what we intend).
2. We delegate 'Check last DB revision' to 'neutron_all' group, but in
   an ideal world this is probably only necessary on 'neutron_server'.
3. When stopping neutron server to run 'Perform a Neutron DB Upgrade',
   we're only stopping it on groups['neutron_server'][0], while all
   other neutron server containers are up servicing requests.
4. Perform a db stamp, which doesn't appear to be necessary.

This change makes the following changes:

1. Checks if migrations have previously run, and if not runs a
   'neutron-db-manage upgrade heads'
2. If migrations have previously run:
   a) it runs an online migration against liberty_expand@head alembic
      branch.
   b) it stops all neutron-server services
   c) it runs an offline migration against liberty_contract@head branch
   d) t starts all neutron-server instances

TODO: Currently, we upgrade liberty_expand@head and
      liberty_contract@head (shutting down neutron-server in the
      proceses), even if there are no pending migrations.  We need to
      find a clean way to check what migration we are on and compare to
      alembic HEADS file to see if we're up to date.  Unfortunately,
      'neutron-db-manage current' doesn't indicate which migration is
      in which alembic branch, so you would have to further grep for
      each migration in the neutron migrations code to determine the
      branch.

NOTE: Liberty introduces the split alembic branches for online/offline
      migrations, see [1] for more information.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/neutron/devref/alembic_migrations.html

Change-Id: I1176b5fe12cad1ee732486ae179e76deea5623e1
Closes-Bug: #1486593
