", 'number': 5}, {'created': '2015-09-01 13:30:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Update how neutron migrations are handled

We're seeing some neutron db sync failures in master branch (liberty).
It looks like there may be a few issues with the way we're handling
migrations:

1. We're not capturing the correct information in the 'Check last DB
   revision' task as the first line returned by 'neutron-db-manage
   history' is a header (this also means that the 'Inspect on disk
   neutron DB revision' task will never do what we intend).
2. We delegate 'Check last DB revision' to 'neutron_all' group, but in
   an ideal world this is probably only necessary on 'neutron_server'.
3. When stopping neutron server to run 'Perform a Neutron DB Upgrade',
   we're only stopping it on groups['neutron_server'][0], while all
   other neutron server containers are up servicing requests.
4. Perform a db stamp, which doesn't appear to be necessary.

This change makes the following changes:

1. Bumps neutron SHA to include 43c00a9, which introduces new
   --expand / --contract upgrade options (otherwise, you have to
   specify liberty_expand@head / liberty_contract@head which may no
   longer work when neutron gets bumped in the future)
2. Checks if migrations have previously run, and if not runs a
   'neutron-db-manage upgrade heads'
3. If migrations have previously run:
   a) it runs an online migration against expand alembic branch using
      'neutron-db-manage upgrade --expand'.
   b) it stops all neutron-server services
   c) it runs an offline migration against contract alembic branch
      using 'neutron-db-manage upgrade --contract'
   d) it starts all neutron-server instances

TODO: Currently, we upgrade liberty_expand@head and
      liberty_contract@head (shutting down neutron-server in the
      proceses), even if there are no pending migrations.  We need to
      find a clean way to check what migration we are on and compare to
      alembic HEADS file to see if we're up to date.  Unfortunately,
      'neutron-db-manage current' doesn't indicate which migration is
      in which alembic branch, so you would have to further grep for
      each migration in the neutron migrations code to determine the
      branch.

NOTE: Liberty introduces the split alembic branches for online/offline
      migrations, see [1] for more information.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/neutron/devref/alembic_migrations.html

      using 'neutron-db-manage upgrade --contract'
   d) it starts all neutron-server instances

TODO: Currently, we upgrade expand and contract branches (shutting down
      neutron-server in the proceses), even if there are no pending
      migrations.  We need to find a clean way to check what migration
      we are on and compare to alembic HEADS file to see if we're up to
      date.  Unfortunately, 'neutron-db-manage current' doesn't indicate
      which migration is in which alembic branch, so you would have to
      further grep for each migration in the neutron migrations code to
      determine the branch.

NOTE: Liberty introduces the split alembic branches for online/offline
      migrations, see [1] for more information.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/neutron/devref/alembic_migrations.html

commit_message:
Update how neutron migrations are handled

We're seeing some neutron db sync failures in master branch (liberty).
It looks like there may be a few issues with the way we're handling
migrations:

1. We're not capturing the correct information in the 'Check last DB
   revision' task as the first line returned by 'neutron-db-manage
   history' is a header (this also means that the 'Inspect on disk
   neutron DB revision' task will never do what we intend).
2. We delegate 'Check last DB revision' to 'neutron_all' group, but in
   an ideal world this is probably only necessary on 'neutron_server'.
3. When stopping neutron server to run 'Perform a Neutron DB Upgrade',
   we're only stopping it on groups['neutron_server'][0], while all
   other neutron server containers are up servicing requests.
4. Perform a db stamp, which doesn't appear to be necessary.

This change makes the following changes:

1. Bumps neutron SHA to include 43c00a9, which introduces new
   --expand / --contract upgrade options (otherwise, you have to
   specify liberty_expand@head / liberty_contract@head which may no
   longer work when neutron gets bumped in the future)
2. Checks if migrations have previously run, and if not runs a
   'neutron-db-manage upgrade heads'
3. If migrations have previously run:
   a) it runs an online migration against expand alembic branch using
      'neutron-db-manage upgrade --expand'.
   b) it stops all neutron-server services
   c) it runs an offline migration against contract alembic branch
      using 'neutron-db-manage upgrade --contract'
   d) it starts all neutron-server instances
4. It removes the temporary pin introduced in
   https://review.openstack.org/218572 as the SHA bump includes the
   upstream fix https://review.openstack.org/218723

TODO: Currently, we upgrade expand and contract branches (shutting down
      neutron-server in the proceses), even if there are no pending
      migrations.  We need to find a clean way to check what migration
      we are on and compare to alembic HEADS file to see if we're up to
      date.  Unfortunately, 'neutron-db-manage current' doesn't indicate
      which migration is in which alembic branch, so you would have to
      further grep for each migration in the neutron migrations code to
      determine the branch.

NOTE: Liberty introduces the split alembic branches for online/offline
      migrations, see [1] for more information.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/neutron/devref/alembic_migrations.html

Change-Id: I1176b5fe12cad1ee732486ae179e76deea5623e1
Closes-Bug: #1486593

commit_message:
Add advanced checks to net templates tests

Perform advanced cheks in tests for networking
templates feature:

 * run network verification before/after
   environment deployment;

 * check IP settings on slaves correspond
   to network configuration in template;

 * check that services are listening on
   networks according to assigned network
   roles in template.

Also increase deployment timeout to 180 minutes.

Related blueprint templates-for-networking
Closes-bug: #1491768

Change-Id: I40b898e24942502654310a842178941198157b60

commit_message:
Fix usage of netaddr '.broadcast'

netaddr 0.7.16 changed the behavior of IPNetworks with /31 and /32
prefixes to make their 'broadcast' attribute return None. This patch
replaces the use of the attribute with a -1 index lookup to get the
last address instead.

Closes-Bug: #1490380
Change-Id: I97d71c4051882ddd9e496c78cfbce840ad7a2b67
(cherry picked from commit 6324f7f23d5debecf7201a371050e20527550a8c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-14 21:35:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix backup metadata import missing fields

When importing backup metadata only required fields were being imported,
and all other fields were being ignored.

This lead to some serious problems when importing metadata back, since
you would lose not only the original Volume ID, but also relevant parent
id information needed to restore incremental backups.

This patch fixes this by importing everything back.

Since API creates a Backup with its own ID we have several cases:
 - Imported backup ID doesn't exist in DB: Update API Backup record with
   the new backup ID
 - Imported backup ID exist in the DB:
   * Backup is available, deleted, error: Update existing record and
     delete from the DB the record that was created by the API
   * In other case: Raise exception

Closes-Bug: #1455043
Change-Id: Ia42ba73e9078d993c63f8e16308151ad11721ea9

commit_message:
Fix backup metadata import missing fields

When importing backup metadata only required fields were being imported,
and all other fields were being ignored.

This led to some serious problems when importing backups back, since
you would lose not only the original Volume ID, but also relevant parent
id information needed to restore incremental backups.

This patch fixes this by importing everything back and creating backup
records with the right ID.

Closes-Bug: #1455043
Closes-Bug: #1476416
Depends-On: Id7ab6e174c1fe85772477f03059c4f457c5c8b17
Change-Id: Ia42ba73e9078d993c63f8e16308151ad11721ea9

commit_message:
Cloud Foundry Service Broker API initial commit

In this commit we added new murano service called murano-cfapi.
It's Cloud Foundry Service Broker API implementation for OpenStack.

* add new entrypoint for murano-cfapi
* add provision/deprovision operations for Cloud Foundry.

partial-implement: bp cloudfoundry-api-support

Change-Id: I5cdb612774f5e46ec7fc787f961e5c7e16ed8501

commit_message:
Use addCleanup rather than tearDown

addCleanup is safer since it's called even if there's an exception
in setUp.

Change-Id: I28d219b5bf0bb14bde757f8f7582ba8ccf3bc679

subject: Use testtools rather than unittest
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 11029, 'name': 'Jamie Finnigan', 'email': 'jamiefinnigan@gmail.com', 'username': 'jamiefinnigan'}, {'_account_id': 11716, 'name': 'Tim Kelsey', 'email': 'timothy.kelsey@uk.ibm.com', 'username': 'tkelsey'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-03 00:02:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Use testtools rather than unittest

Some tests used unittest as the base class while others used
testtools. All the tests now use testtools since it provides more
functionality.

testtools fails if the tearDown doesn't call the super
implementation so this is fixed.

testtools also uses assertRaises differently.

Change-Id: I010010d1eaf32c82b78f72946fef3f59d2305818
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-09-03 00:05:13.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/core/test_util.py', 'tests/unit/core/test_config.py', 'tests/functional/test_functional.py'], 'message': "Use testtools rather than unittest

Some tests used unittest as the base class while others used
testtools. All the tests now use testtools since it provides more
functionality.

testtools fails if the tearDown doesn't call the super
implementation so this is fixed.

testtools also uses assertRaises differently.

Change-Id: I010010d1eaf32c82b78f72946fef3f59d2305818
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Use testtools rather than unittest

Some tests used unittest as the base class while others used
testtools. All the tests now use testtools since it provides more
functionality.

testtools fails if the tearDown doesn't call the super
implementation so this is fixed.

testtools also uses assertRaises differently.

Change-Id: I010010d1eaf32c82b78f72946fef3f59d2305818

commit_message:
Remove redundant quotes in bandit.yaml

Yaml will automatically interpret data types and strings in this
case for the most part.  Some special characters such as '.' still
need to be escaped with quotes.

Change-Id: Ib3237fe52e1c144b9ad6d641c1359ed5e3ab75c6

commit_message:
Changed readme so that example retrieves certificate

Made a change to the URL that the readme uses to demonstrate basic
Anchor functionality. This reflects the default CA setup in the
simple config.json that Anchor ships with today.

Note: The examples for auth/config are still outdated but at least
the README example usage works. auth/config updates can be covered
in another bug/commit.

', 'number': 8}, {'created': '2015-08-30 22:03:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Version-aware YAML loading

* Refactoring of "packages" Python package
* Now MuranoPL YAML classes can be parsed by different engines
depending on Format string in package manifest

With this change MuranoPL classes will no longer
be read and parsed (including YAQL expressions parsing)
upon package load but only on first class access and
with ability to peak different parsers depending on
format version specified in manifest. As a consequence
it is now possible to use different YAQL engines for
different package format versions. Also startup
time was greatly improved as unneeded classes are no more
parsed and logos and UI forms are not loaded.

Change-Id: I23fc5da1a43b405d526438329dc04aed589dee13

commit_message:
Version-aware YAML loading

* Refactoring of "packages" Python package
* Now MuranoPL YAML classes can be parsed by different engines
depending on Format string in package manifest

With this change MuranoPL classes will no longer
be read and parsed (including YAQL expressions parsing)
upon package load but only on first class access and
with ability to peak different parsers depending on
format version specified in manifest. As a consequence
it is now possible to use different YAQL engines for
different package format versions. Also startup
time was greatly improved as unneeded classes are no more
parsed and logos and UI forms are not loaded.

Partially implements: blueprint murano-versioning

Change-Id: I23fc5da1a43b405d526438329dc04aed589dee13

commit_message:
Restores back plugin support

During reworking of how MuranoPL works with packages and
removal or class-loader plugin support code was broken and
temporary disabled. This commit restores previous functionality
using new PackageLoader and MuranoPackage classes

Change-Id: Id43807bfbb9093ddf9a1fbd9273d2fc34e8e5f59

', 'number': 12}, {'created': '2015-08-30 21:56:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Package versioning

With this change MuranoPackage become first-class DSL citizens.
Packages have version, runtime_version (that is specified 
in Format attribute of manifest file) and list of classes.
Previously engine use to have package loader which had most
of load functionality and class loader that mostly act as an
adapter from package loader to interface that DSL used to 
get classes. Now class loader is none and replaced with 
package loader at the DSL level. Package loader is responsible
for loading package by either package or class name (as it was 
before) and semantic_version version spec (like ">=1.2,<2.0").
Package loader can keep track of several versions of the same
package.

Also package now have requirements each with version spec.
All class names that encounter in application code are
looked up only within requirements. As a consequence 
packages that use other packages without referencing
them explicitly will break. An exception from this rule
is core library which is referenced automatically.


Partially implements: blueprint murano-versioning

commit_message:
Package versioning

With this change MuranoPackage becomes first-class DSL citizen.
Packages have version, runtime_version (that is specified
in Format attribute of the manifest file) and a list of classes.
Previously engine used to have package loader which had most
of "load" functionality and class loader that mostly acted as an
adapter from package loader to interface that DSL used to
get classes. Now class loader is gone and is replaced with
package loader at the DSL level. Package loader is responsible
for loading packages by either package or class name (as it was
before) plus semantic_version spec (for example ">=1.2,<2.0").
Package loader can now keep track of several versions of the same
package.

Also packages now have requirements with version specs.
All class names that are encountered in application code are
looked up within requirements only. As a consequence
packages that use other packages without referencing
them explicitly will become broken. An exception from this rule
is core library which is referenced automatically.

Partially implements: blueprint murano-versioning

Change-Id: I8789ba45b6210e71bf4977a766f82b66d2a2d270

commit_message:
Use Share Instance ID in 'name' property

Use Share Instance ID in 'name' property instead of
proxyfing 'name' property of a share.

Change-Id: I0058987424f5cdfb931a9805d08fc69bff859f5b
Closes-Bug: #1489526

[{'created': '2015-06-18 12:28:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Stanardized Functional Tests

The functional tests included some tests for creating AES keys with
different bit lengths. Most of those bit lengths were not valid. The
tests can cause some secret stores to return failures because the key
lengths were not valid. The tests were also setting the bit length to
different values but not modifying the payload. The payload is now
being created for appropriate bit length.

One of the tests was passing the algorithm and bit length as part of a
storage operation. The algorithm name was invalid. This can cause some
failures on devices that do not support that algorithm. I removed that
test case.

Change-Id: Ia425abef9232cd6729a23e87cbf8153f211a49a3

', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-09-03 00:08:58.000000000', 'files': ['functionaltests/api/v1/functional/test_secrets.py'], 'message': 'Stanardized Functional Tests

The functional tests included some tests for creating AES keys with
different bit lengths. Most of those bit lengths were not valid. The
tests can cause some secret stores to return failures because the key
lengths were not valid. The tests were also setting the bit length to
different values but not modifying the payload. The payload is now
being created for the appropriate bit length.

One of the tests was passing the algorithm and bit length as part of a
storage operation. The algorithm name was invalid. This can cause some
failures on devices that do not support that algorithm.

The tests that use non-standard algorithms or bit lengths were

', 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Stanardized Functional Tests

The functional tests included some tests for creating AES keys with
different bit lengths. Most of those bit lengths were not valid. The
tests can cause some secret stores to return failures because the key
lengths were not valid. The tests were also setting the bit length to
different values but not modifying the payload. The payload is now
being created for the appropriate bit length.

One of the tests was passing the algorithm and bit length as part of a
storage operation. The algorithm name was invalid. This can cause some
failures on devices that do not support that algorithm.

The tests that use non-standard algorithms or bit lengths were
decorated with a non-standard-algorithm attribute. This will allow
testers to skip those tests when selecting which ones to run.

Change-Id: Ia425abef9232cd6729a23e87cbf8153f211a49a3

been added, we'll be able to upload our patch containing it.  This
will give the puppet openstack team a simple multinode job to work
with to better understand nodepool subnodes lifecycle.

Change-Id: Ibac4c9af362d9a6c548b9d0d672f9ace3020f0cc
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
", 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Experimental multinode job for puppet-openstack-integration

This is the first step needed to run a multinode environment for
puppet-openstack-integration module. For now, this is experimental and
will require some time to flesh out some of nodepool functionality.

Currently run_multinode.sh does not exist, however once this gate has
been added, we'll be able to upload our patch containing it.  This
will give the puppet openstack team a simple multinode job to work
with to better understand nodepool subnodes lifecycle.

Change-Id: Ibac4c9af362d9a6c548b9d0d672f9ace3020f0cc
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Copy the code of Glance V3 (artifacts) client

As Glance Program has decided not to release the client for
EXPERIMENTAL v3 API in its python-glanceclient library until the API
is considered stable, we cannot consume artifacts API from any of the
released glance clients.

It was decided (see [1]) to temporary copy the v3 client code from
python-glanceclient into the python-muranoclient so murano may consume
it without depending on custom builds of glance client. This patch
copies appropriate code.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-August/072740.html

Implements-blueprint: artifact-repository-support
Change-Id: I7905f7c7613c976216be7887f0444e1a09835287

commit_message:
Add timeout to the openstack comamnd

* Timeout openstack command after 20 seconds
  in case if it's not responding.
* Retry failed openstack comamnds

Change-Id: I63b7d6e89888d9fc97ecf88c46a01ece80ca9c63
Related-Bug: 1490523

commit_message:
Collecting stats with enabled SSL fixed

In case of enabled SSL for cluster we should set 'https_proxy'
environment variable.
We can't validate SSL certificate due to:
 - https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1491805
 - https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1491811
As temporary workaround SSL verification disabled for stats fetchers.

Change-Id: If04d99d4293caab50f89fc51209a1e9ca071ab63
Closes-Bug: #1491015

commit_message:
Make sure Neutron_config is applied before Neutron_network

When creating a Neutron_network, the provider will read the actual
configuration file. If Neutron_config has not be applied before, the
default configuration will be used and probably Keystone
authentification will fail.

So this patch aims to make sure neutron.conf is filled before trying to
create a network.

Depends-on: Ibd90e5e159f9a1fbff3990241795894e0bdca3cc
Change-Id: Ia9141cb387a98c70cc639db724da4af4b3289d8a

subject: Make sure Nova_admin_tenant_id_setter is executed after Keystone_endpoint
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 7156, 'name': 'Mathieu Gagn√©', 'email': 'mgagne@calavera.ca', 'username': 'mgagne'}, {'_account_id': 9500, 'name': 'Matt Fischer', 'email': 'matt@mattfischer.com', 'username': 'mfisch'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-26 04:02:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Make sure Nova_admin_tenant_id_setter is executed after Keystone_endpoint

This patch aims to make sure Nova_admin_tenant_id_setter is run after creating Neutron
endpoint Keystone resource by using the Puppet chain arrow.
Keystone_endpoint is actually the latest resource created by Keystone
providers to make Neutron working.
If Nova_admin_tenant_id_setter resource is in the catalog, it will be executed when
keystone & glance are actually ready and not before.

Change-Id: I095834d3b483db3bf5361f00577e80cfcc6fccc6

commit_message:
Make sure Nova_admin_tenant_id_setter is executed after Keystone_endpoint

This patch aims to make sure Nova_admin_tenant_id_setter is run after creating Neutron
endpoint Keystone resource by using the Puppet chain arrow.
Keystone_endpoint is actually the latest resource created by Keystone
providers to make Neutron working.
If Nova_admin_tenant_id_setter resource is in the catalog, it will be executed when
keystone & glance are actually ready and not before.

Depends-on: Ibd90e5e159f9a1fbff3990241795894e0bdca3cc
Change-Id: I095834d3b483db3bf5361f00577e80cfcc6fccc6

When an SQL-config-based domain-specific backend was loaded the

local config file should not be used in this case.

Closes-Bug: 1489118
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Stop reading local config for domain-specific SQL config driver

When an SQL-config-based domain-specific backend was loaded the
local config file (/etc/keystone/keystone.conf) was also read. The
local config file should not be used in this case.

This caused running the tests locally to fail if there were changes
in /etc/keystone/keystone.conf.

Change-Id: Idd095b2df375329f579c164d00dfd50b41b0e96d
Closes-Bug: 1489118

[{'created': '2015-09-03 15:22:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Revert "Specify heartbeat for connection to RabbitMQ"

This reverts commit e24ca066bf6160bc1e419aaa5d486cad1aaa937d.

Unfortunately, such a small timeout for hearbeats cause an incredible regression for Astute <-> RabbitMQ connectivity.

Basically, if Astute's sending a huge message to RabbitMQ and by some reason we aren't able to do it within 2 seconds (heartbeat timeout), the connection will be dropped by RabbitMQ server.

In fact, that's happened on SWARM while

* Astute takes almost 100% CPU usage (bug #1491794)
* Astute's sending diagnostic snapshot result message to Nailgun (more than 4MB of data).

Since heartbeats aren't solve the problem we have tried to fix, let's revert it.

Change-Id: I8734541c026b86506a6f735b1eb55371b393921c
Related-Bug: #1461562

reason we aren't able to do it within 2 seconds (heartbeat timeout),

In fact, that's happened on SWARM while

* Astute takes almost 100% CPU usage (bug #1491794)
* Astute's sending diagnostic snapshot result message to Nailgun

Since heartbeats aren't solve the problem we have tried to fix, let's

', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Revert "Specify heartbeat for connection to RabbitMQ"

Unfortunately, such a small timeout for hearbeats cause an incredible
regression for Astute <-> RabbitMQ connectivity.

Basically, if Astute's sending a huge message to RabbitMQ and by some
reason we aren't able to do it within 2 seconds (heartbeat timeout),
the connection will be dropped by RabbitMQ server.

In fact, that's happened on SWARM while

* Astute takes almost 100% CPU usage (bug #1491794)
* Astute's sending diagnostic snapshot result message to Nailgun
  (more than 4MB of data).

Since heartbeats aren't solve the problem we have tried to fix, let's
revert the original commit e24ca066bf6160bc1e419aaa5d486cad1aaa937d.

Change-Id: I8734541c026b86506a6f735b1eb55371b393921c
Related-Bug: #1461562

commit_message:
Make sure rabbitmq package is installed

Ensure that rabbitmq package is installed before murano
service configuration.

DocImpact: detached RabbitMQ + Murano resulting in rabbitmq being
installed on the controller anyway.

Change-Id: Ia8852a625566ab1742e584d742e9820329328e0c
Closes-Bug: #1491334

commit_message:
Create openstack-base container

This creates and moves the dependencies for Ubuntu into a common
openstack-base container. This commit shows dramatically smaller
sizes for all non-openstack containers. The Openstack container remain
the same size.

Change-Id: I2f46420d4b9edcfddda374caddcce906fc708f6c
Partially-Implements: blueprint openstack-common-container

commit_message:
Reduce install size

This is a trade-off, it increases the base size some _but_ it
decreases the total size by a few hundred MB.

Partially-Implements: blueprint openstack-common-container

Change-Id: I1216deed122aa734e0c84325264a53711d94ea4c

commit_message:
Enable Translator with new TOSCA library (3)

Remove tests which are specific to  TOSCA parser. They are alredy part of
TOSCA Parse repository.

Partially Implements: blueprint use-tosca-parser-library

Change-Id: I64b948270b896b5cd24ff5dd798da8484ba9e1bf

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-06 15:49:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Enable BIOS reboot timeout for kvm/qemu instances

This change allows to set the reboot timeout in libvirt domain if the
image metadata (property-name "hw_reboot_timeout") or flavor extra spec
(name "hw:reboot_timeout") is configured to set it.
This reboot timeout controls whether and after how long the guest
should start booting again in case the boot fails.
The value is in milliseconds with maximum of 65535 and special value -1
(default) disables the reboot.
It is especially advantageous in combination with a boot menu enabled,
since in that case the user can select for error a non bootable volume.

Change-Id: I2cab3498ee947d5c35a893d75fd4715255b7751f
Related-Bug: #1275311

commit_message:
Enable BIOS reboot timeout for kvm/qemu instances

This change allows to set the reboot timeout in libvirt domain if the
image metadata (property-name "hw_reboot_timeout") or flavor extra spec
(name "hw:reboot_timeout") is configured to set it.
This reboot timeout controls whether and after how long the guest
should start booting again in case the boot fails.
The value is in milliseconds with maximum of 65535 and special value -1
(default) disables the reboot.
It is especially advantageous in combination with a boot menu enabled,
since in that case the user can select for error a non bootable volume.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I2cab3498ee947d5c35a893d75fd4715255b7751f
Related-Bug: #1275311

commit_message:
Remove the blacklisted nova-cells shelve tests

nova-cells does not support the shelve feature.
Since the nova-cells shelve tests are now disabled using
the tempest feature config options, we can remove the
shelve tests from the blacklist.

Change-Id: Ic819a3d23ab8aa78ea0cfd1673dd859f07f12b40
Closes-bug: 1491152
Depends-On: Ibf1f9aaa63e5f17b7d8774b511940ba8421e0887

commit_message:
Enabled passing of virt properties when creating instance

The 'virt-properties' extension provides ability to pass
'os-command-line', 'hw_qemu_guest_agent', 'vmware_linked_clone'
at instance creation time.  Libvirt driver
now checks both driver_metadata and image metadata when looking
for 'os_command_line'.

bp: add-ability-to-pass-driver-meta-when-starting-instance

Change-Id: I353393c0d36702624c657ada536233110a1db6cb

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-02-01 22:34:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Libvirt allow for enabling BIOS bootmenu

Bug 1275311

Extends the XML config generator to support a new bootmenu option,
controlled by a new config parameter:

    libvirt.bootmenu = True (default)

When enabled, all but AMI based instances will prompt for bringing
up a boot menu via F12. This allows booting off volumes, for
example, or any device not represented as the first disk.

DocImpact

commit_message:
Libvirt allow for enabling BIOS bootmenu

Extends the XML config generator to support a new bootmenu option,
controlled by a new config parameter:

    libvirt.bootmenu = True (default)

When enabled, all but AMI based instances will prompt for bringing
up a boot menu via F12. This allows booting off volumes, for
example, or any device not represented as the first disk.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Iec15e841f92994f04c0feadb22a1dfd0395fd610
Closes-Bug: 1275311

commit_message:
Neutron: Add option to set gateway when creating router

When creating a router, you can specify an external network as a
gateway, but since it requires the network ID it's not something you
can specify statically in a task config. This adds a new option,
set_gateway, to dynamically set the external gateway of a router to
the network that is created as part of the scenario.

This also adds a new function to the Neutron utils, _create_routers,
that creates a network and a given number of subnets and routers.

Change-Id: Id7101a3a47b3a009ba39f08ebd5f2b3bf2fd5ab7

[{'created': '2015-08-13 17:37:57.000000000', 'files': ['lib/astute/config.rb', 'lib/astute/server/worker.rb'], 'message': 'Specify heartbeat for connection to RabbitMQ

There was default heartbeat which was set in RabbitMQ to 580 seconds.
Change it to smaller amount of seconds in order to detect connectivity
problems earlier.

Change-Id: I3674829d525006c7bfad96e725b7ab4d559144e2
Closes-bug: #1483182
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Specify heartbeat for connection to RabbitMQ

There was default heartbeat which was set in RabbitMQ to 580 seconds.
Change it to smaller amount of seconds in order to detect connectivity
problems earlier.

Change-Id: I3674829d525006c7bfad96e725b7ab4d559144e2

commit_message:
Fix Accept header in SAML2 requests

The ; separator allows providing parameters to a type not separating
type options. This means that in strict type checks like those performed
by mod_auth_mellon the check for accept type fails.

Change-Id: Ieeaa74b304921daef68497fec77cc6629ab2f0a2
Closes-Bug: #1488722

commit_message:
unregister_machine blocking logic

Additional logic to preemptively prevent NIC removal when a
machine is unregistered by pre-validating if a node is can be
safely deleted.

commit_message:
Avoid 2.27.0 of novaclient

There is an unfortunate set of bugs out in the wild which make
2.27.0 novaclient non-working against many existing public clouds. Fixes
are in works for 2.28.0 - for now, express that 2.27.0 should not be
used.

Change-Id: Ia6cc574c8ec8bf1290f01d5a602dd2b8ee78549d

commit_message:
Make sure neutron network is created before Tempest_neutron_net_id_setter

In the catalog, Tempest_neutron_net_id_setter requires the network
created before so this manifest can be run in one single puppet run and
be idempotent.

This patch aims to require Neutron_network in the catalog before
Tempest_neutron_net_id_setter.

Change-Id: Ie17fad1ae8fd0072515ca30fcfe91df1347b3391

commit_message:
[ironic-agent] Use svc-map for enabling agent

Switch to using svc-map element for systemd based agent.

This allows both .deb and .rpm installs to share the
element for systemd based installs. There are not any
plans to package a .rpm package for upstart or sysv, so
these are left as is.

Change-Id: Idca7ad97355cae785162989774a7e6dea6fdc5b5
Closes-Bug: #1490584

Adds HostUtilsV2 class

to return the proper class.

subject: Ensure rsync restarts fully during swift setup
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6816, 'name': 'Jesse Pretorius', 'email': 'jesse@odyssey4.me', 'username': 'jesse-pretorius'}, {'_account_id': 7217, 'name': 'Hugh Saunders', 'email': 'hugh@wherenow.org', 'username': 'hughsaunders'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 12606, 'name': 'Miguel Grinberg', 'email': 'miguel.grinberg@gmail.com', 'username': 'miguelgrinberg'}, {'_account_id': 12807, 'name': 'Steve Lewis (stevelle)', 'email': 'stevelle@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevelle'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-26 18:45:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Ensure rsync restarts fully during swift setup

Existing rsync stop/start handlers were relying on the pattern
parameter to the Ansible service module which relies on the results
of ps to determine if the service is running. This is unnecessary
because the rsync service script is well-behaved and responds
appropriately to start stop and restart commands. Removal of the
pattern param ensures that the response from the service command is
used instead.

Root cause of the bug is that when Keystone was changed to share
fernet secrets via rsync over ssh tunnel, an rsync process was
introduced in AIOs, Swift stand-alones, and other deployment
configurations that contain Keystone containers on the storage hosts.

The resulting rsync processes within Keystone containers pollute the
results of ps commands on the host, fooling Ansible into thinking
that an rsync service is running on the standard port when it is not.

Secondly, the handler responsible for stopping rsync was not causing
the notice for "Ensure rsync service running" to trigger cleanly in
my testing, so the tasks were changed to trigger both notices in an
ordered list.

Change-Id: I5ed47f7c1974d6b22eeb2ff5816ee6fa30ee9309
Closes-Bug: 1481121

commit_message:
Ensure rsync restarts fully during swift setup

Existing rsync stop/start handlers were relying on the pattern
parameter to the Ansible service module which relies on the results
of ps to determine if the service is running. This is unnecessary
because the rsync service script is well-behaved and responds
appropriately to start stop and restart commands. Removal of the
pattern param ensures that the response from the service command is
used instead.

Root cause of the bug is that when Keystone was changed to share
fernet secrets via rsync over ssh tunnel, an rsync process was
introduced in AIOs, Swift stand-alones, and other deployment
configurations that contain Keystone containers on the storage hosts.

The resulting rsync processes within Keystone containers pollute the
results of ps commands on the host, fooling Ansible into thinking
that an rsync service is running on the standard port when it is not.

Secondly, the handler responsible for stopping rsync was not causing
the notice for "Ensure rsync service running" to trigger cleanly in
my testing, so the tasks were changed to trigger both notices in an
ordered list.

Change-Id: I5ed47f7c1974d6b22eeb2ff5816ee6fa30ee9309
Closes-Bug: 1481121

commit_message:
Make rebuild/evacuate use resource claims

We make sure that rebuild now uses claims and resource tracking. This
means that we will now be properly tracking resources for
rebuilt/evacuated instances and will potentially fail if a move of the
instance breaks policy set by the scheduler (an exception would be in
case we bypassed the scheduler).

We also make sure that we update the migration record with the current
status (either success or failure).

On a failure to claim, we will currently just error out the instance
which requires manual intervention, but taking advantage of the retry
mechanism could be added in the future.

Since none of the required args are sent yet, this change is effectively
a no-op, until we change the rebuild_instance RPC method to send the
required data over.

Related-blueprint: migration-fix-resource-tracking
Change-Id: Ia068494b1a4c43123fe172d67a81ac0b60682995

commit_message:
compute: Make rebuild consider the node that was passed in

We add some of the keyword args that will need to be passed in for the
claims to work (scheduled_node, limits, and the migration object).

Since we will be sending the node name to the rebuild operation, we
will be able to use it and avoid a DB hit. This commit makes sure we take
advantage of that.

Change-Id: Id51c371f9875b8e2b7f4cda6f7a88273b13bb3af
Related-blueprint: migration-fix-resource-tracking

commit_message:
Allow cinder-backup to use ceph

This change updates ceph_client and os_cinder roles to allow
cinder-backup to use ceph.  We also create a new group called
'cinder_backup' which allows us to only retreive the cinder backup key
if cinder-backup is actually in use.

To use, you would simply need to set cinder_service_backup_driver to
cinder.backup.drivers.ceph in your user_variables.yml file.

NOTE: You will need to update your
      /etc/openstack_deploy/env.d/cinder.yml in order for this change
      to execute successfully.

Change-Id: Ib94effa40208bbc8de0f78c5487316be007adcf1
Closes-Bug: #1481787
Implements: blueprint ceph-block-devices
DocImpact
(cherry picked from commit 44d3f25de6daab8073137c9fc76edcdfc23c716f)

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-04 06:16:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add support for swift proxy config: sorting_method

When read_affinity is used and sorting_method is not used warnings
are generated in the swift proxy log indicating that the
read_affinity is not being respected. Other values for sorting_method
exist and could be valuable options for deployers so it is supported
fully as a swift proxy var rather than having a value set to affinity
when read_affinity is specified.

DocImpact
Closes-bug: 1480581

Change-Id: I3cab89c95f288b4a59f4dd3c7360daca7a4f47bf
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-08-25 03:43:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add support for swift proxy config: sorting_method

are generated in the swift proxy log indicating that the

this change sets the sorting_method to affinity automatically, and

commit_message:
Add sorting_method to swift proxy config as needed

When read_affinity is used and sorting_method is not used warnings
are generated in the swift proxy log indicating that the
read_affinity is not being respected. When read_affinity is specified
this change sets the sorting_method to affinity automatically, and
otherwise uses a configured value which defaults to shuffle.

Note that write_affinity does not respect sorting_method and follows
a different code path and does not issue warnings in logs when used
without sorting_method.

Closes-bug: 1480581
Co-Authored-By: Andy McCrae <andy.mccrae@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I3cab89c95f288b4a59f4dd3c7360daca7a4f47bf

commit_message:
Update path to subunit2html in post_test_hook

Per:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-August/072982.html

The location of subunit2html changed on the images in the gate
so update the path used in the post_test_hook.

Long-term we should just use what's in devstack-gate.

Change-Id: I5e50e7d7ad845aba26403df1df412c0a139a6dc7
Closes-Bug: #1491646

commit_message:
Murano versioning

This specification proposes set of arrangements that are going to allow Murano
keep backward compatibility with applications written for older version while
still making possible to introduce incompatible changes to any part of the
project

Change-Id: I5ac638974a3fbd5a75750f7ef5cb7a84299db499

commit_message:
[WIP] Switch to oslo-config-generator

Remove openstack.common.config package.
Remove tools/config folder.
Add etc/oslo-config-generator/cinder.conf
Add cinder.opts module and collect all options from project.

Temporary add the old and new cinder.conf.sample files for comparing.
Implement a script for comparing the old and new configuration files.

Closes-Bug: #1473768
Change-Id: I6e7be74d1a774a6fd1d6d870336cb227a1570144

commit_message:
Enable execute bit on swift sync for directories

Sometimes during sync, directories are created with
644 permissions instead of 755. This mainly impacts
controller reinstallation where resyncing existing
creates inaccessible data files.

Change-Id: I0ad8dfc308324c5a354e13331f0fb6604502b49b
Closes-Bug: #1490960

commit_message:
Rediscover hdisk if connection info refreshed

Although the UDID for a VSCSI attached volume is saved in the bdm
during attach, it can be lost if the connection information is
'refreshed' by the compute manager.  This fix rediscovers the hdisk
during detach if we cannot look it up via the UDID. One scenario
where the connection info is refreshed is live migration.

Change-Id: I13846c494d72d57e47082d4d0fb2a286309aa0f1

commit_message:
Fix RequestSpec.instance_group hydration

A mistake was done by hydrating the members field for the InstanceGroup object when
creating the RequestSpec object because that field is for getting the instances,
not the hosts. In order to provide that information, we need to provide a new
version of the InstanceGroup and give a lazy-load for getting it in case we want to
have it.

Change-Id: I0d892bbe490c9ee727f54077d7398cc2800ce107
Partially-Implements: blueprint request-spec-object

commit_message:
Port the AMQP1 driver to new Pyngus SASL API

Pyngus 2.0 includes a new API for configuring SASL credentials.
Previous versions of Pyngus did not provide this API - the driver had
to invoke Proton APIs in order to configure user credentials.  Moving
to the Pyngus API will preserve compatibility with older versions of
Proton, since the next release of Proton wil be changing its SASL API.

Pyngus 2.0 also adds strict enforcement of callback re-entrancy
constrants.  This patch fixes some bad driver reentrancy violations.

Closes-bug: #1473515
Change-Id: Iddccefd3ee3c9092c086fc54e3810f78d5df9338

This patch updates the default firstboot scripts
for TripleO so that we always create a 'heat-admin'
user. This is important because Heat
recently removed the instance_user option which we used to set
the previous 'heat-admin' default user (see
I9d01c5e7de630df5058429353fa17b3536ee8807 or git commit
e423bec7f10b0f5d07f05d195b3b7860f6bceb00 in Heat for details).

Change-Id: Ib20c8375c9fb35e5221fd3aeb0c052c332c66ff3
Related-bug: #1229849
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Set 'heat-admin' as the default user

This patch updates the default firstboot scripts
for TripleO so that we always create a 'heat-admin'
user. This is important because Heat
recently removed the instance_user option which we used to set
the previous 'heat-admin' default user (see
I9d01c5e7de630df5058429353fa17b3536ee8807 or git commit
e423bec7f10b0f5d07f05d195b3b7860f6bceb00 in Heat for details).

Change-Id: Ib20c8375c9fb35e5221fd3aeb0c052c332c66ff3
Related-bug: #1229849

commit_message:
Expose VIF net-id attribute in os-virtual-interfaces

Adds a new microversion to show virtual interface 'net-id' in
virtual interface list.

DocImpact - See nova/api/openstack/rest_api_version_history.rst
for details

APIImpact

Implements blueprint add-vif-net-id-in-vif-list

Change-Id: Ic8b26df8d7e69bd71d23dfbc983fa3449c16fa7d

commit_message:
To use id instead of name when making credentials from context

If tenant_name or user_name has chinese characters,
an 'UnicodeEncodeError' exception raised when making
credentials from request context.
There are two solutions to fix this problem:
1. Call encodeutils.safe_encode to encode the tenant_name
with utf-8 before using.
2. Modify to use tenant_id/user_id instead
of name as other OpenStack projects(Nova, Cinder, Neutron...)
did.

This patch select the  option2 to fix the problem.

Change-Id: I2510405b7b2cc9125828a19a151a56bcd44c2222
Closes-Bug: #1488754

commit_message:
Tokenless authz with X.509 SSL client certificate

Implemented middleware to map an incoming trusted SSL client certificate
into Keystone auth credential so we can perform authorization without
having to issue a token.

TODO: to submit a separate patch to devstack to enable this feature.

Co-authored-by: guang-yee <guang.yee@hp.com>

SecurityImapct
DocImpact
implements bp keystone-tokenless-authz-with-x509-ssl-client-cert

Change-Id: Icc7305ca9d96f8e9cdc95ccde57de650801c6544

commit_message:
Fix import path in neutron-sanity-check for ml2_sriov opts

neutron-sanity-check fails while importing ml2_sriov
configuration. This patch fixes the import path and
also includes a unit test to avoid such issues.

Closes-Bug: #1489374
Change-Id: I4265ee78be9e7f83e35c94187d4577b32005bef9

commit_message:
Allow to use Keystone via 'keystone/api' network

Restrict access to Keystone API from network with
'keystone/api' role, so from outside a cloud it
could be reached only via public VIP.

Change-Id: I6e2004e53591e0cc0b2a5b43a83532d3de9aef9a
Closes-bug: #1489057

commit_message:
Fixed issue with cacert parameter

We need to use parameter cacert instead of ca_file parameter
to work with CA certificates like python clients for other
OpenStack services.

Also fixed typo (after copy paste from Glance code).

Change-Id: Ibe36390aab2f2edb0fe7670f76f61caeb350d34b
Closes-Bug: #1487099

This reverts commit e63709d16bd4c1949bef820ac336c9393c040d25.

AsyncLogger's worker thread takes almost 100% CPU because it infinitely iterates over a logger queue. A simple "sleep 0.2" will solve this problem, but I have doubts about that AsyncLogger helps us anyway. It's better to revert this fix and investigate a real cause of our problems.

commit_message:
Revert "Implement asynchronous logger for event callbacks"

This reverts commit e63709d16bd4c1949bef820ac336c9393c040d25.

AsyncLogger's worker thread takes almost 100% CPU because
it infinitely iterates over a logger queue. A simple
"sleep 0.2" will solve this problem, but I have doubts
about that AsyncLogger helps us anyway. It's better to
revert this fix and investigate a real cause of our problems.

Closes-Bug: 1491794
Related-Bug: 1487397

Change-Id: I95d57de9ef92c717b8b07f7832ab258c0b35b6a5

commit_message:
devstack: resolve image name via image-list, not image-show

python-glanceclient v1.0.0 was recently released and now defaults to
glance api V2.  The client shell for v2 does not offer referencing things
by name and requires we resolve the ID ourselves.  This switches resolving
the id by name and instead pulls it from image-list.

Change-Id: Ib215767f22e5fb8d189e34ea605d1a904d0e7d62

commit_message:
Fix silently overwrite user specified content type

Previously, even user specified the response content type of api
'catalog/packages/<package_id>/ui', which will be silently replaced
by text/plain. To improve it, add list 'specific_content_types' to
make resource controller can specify different content type for each
action. And it will raise exception when user specified content type
is unsupported.

Change-Id: I5d56461333d730f0f9fbe715e9bb066e5b004203
Closes-Bug: #1476543

commit_message:
Upgrade the OpenStack environment 6.1 to 7.0

Add chapter to Operations document with description of procedure that upgrades
Mirantis OpenStack environment 6.1 to 7.0 for limited set of Reference
Architecture options.

Implements: blueprint upgrade-major-openstack-environment

commit_message:
Fix docker package name in Ubuntu 14.04 in Install Guide

This patch fixes docker package name in Install Guide.
In case of Ubuntu 14.04, the docker package name is 'docker.io', but
not 'docker'.

Change-Id: If2913cdfe370c511aaa70e8079462f76662cc116

commit_message:
Add image signing verification

This patch adds support for the image signing feature by adding the
ability for glance to verify a signature.

This patch still needs:
 * castellan added to global requirements (see Depends-On below)

Depends-On: I2283d2853d4ccd6d41d706db5b02cf6c74c5ba93
Change-Id: I0b0592a3526a4e4f5b39ae6ce8b4dedd0ccc31d9
Implements: blueprint image-signing-and-verification-support

commit_message:
Engine method validate_template fails for unavailable resource type

When validate_template() method is called with unavailable resource type,
it will fails the template validation.

Change-Id: Id141b7e63d7a58fade8a29d0dd5c6a1f9c847f5e
Closes-Bug: #1473025

attempt. This patch uses bdm v2 instead to workaround the bug.

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-09-03 11:38:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Use bdm v2 to boot ebs instance for gating

commit_message:
Use bdm v2 to boot ebs instance for gating

novaclient 2.27.0 has a bug with legacy bdm, and fails on instance boot
attempt. This patch uses bdm v2 instead to workaround the bug.

Change-Id: I3d856b2ba4116c19ab936db63d29413fdfbf31e0

commit_message:
Adding option for Java jobs to be adapted to Oozie

Adding an option for enabling Java jobs to set the
"adapt_for_oozie" flag to automatically modify the job
configs at runtime.  Also adding a unit test that includes
the new option.

Change-Id: Iede36c178aef07912d6f69621d69c1657d1c79b4
Closes-Bug: #1445471

commit_message:
[Sahara] Move node processes selection to own tab

Sahara already have plugin that have huge amout of node processes.
So, sometimes during node group creation it's hard to find some process
from selected service.

So, this patch resolves that issue, because it move node processes selection
to separate tab, and also groups node processes by services.

Implements blueprint: sahara-node-processes-tab
Change-Id: I38cca7e687da1d1c82a5f40cb5846765aa1e43f2

subject: Fix gating for DevStack switched to Nova v2.1 by default
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 9312, 'name': 'Alexandre Levine', 'email': 'alexandrelevine@gmail.com', 'username': 'alevine'}, {'_account_id': 10234, 'name': 'Andrey Pavlov', 'email': 'andrey.mp@gmail.com', 'username': 'andrey-mp'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-03 09:44:41.000000000', 'files': ['ec2api/tests/unit/test_clients.py', 'ec2api/tests/contrib/post_test_hook.sh', 'ec2api/api/clients.py'], 'message': "Fix gating for DevStack switched to Nova v2.1 by default

Use bdm v2 to boot ebs instance for gating

novaclient 2.27.0 has a bug with legacy bdm, and fails on instance boot
attempt. This patch uses bdm v2 instead to workaround the bug.

Change-Id: I3d856b2ba4116c19ab936db63d29413fdfbf31e0

Use 'compute' service type by default

It was a grand error to use not default service type as a service type
by default. Now DevStack provides v2.1 by 'compute' service type, does
not provide 'computev21' at all. Because that gating fails.

Change-Id: I8a68d331583ea575a5883cd2c451245a9119016b
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix gating for DevStack switched to Nova v2.1 by default

Use bdm v2 to boot ebs instance for gating

novaclient 2.27.0 has a bug with legacy bdm, and fails on instance boot
attempt. This patch uses bdm v2 instead to workaround the bug.

Change-Id: I3d856b2ba4116c19ab936db63d29413fdfbf31e0

Use 'compute' service type by default

It was a grand error to use not default service type as a service type
by default. Now DevStack provides v2.1 by 'compute' service type, does
not provide 'computev21' at all. Because that gating fails.

Change-Id: I8a68d331583ea575a5883cd2c451245a9119016b

commit_message:
[RN7-0] OpenStack Kilo support

1. Adds support for OpenStack Kilo
2. Updates the versions of the major components
3. Deletes some unnecessary files from the previous release

commit_message:
Remove hardcoded config drive enforcement

This change removes the forced use of config drive to ensure that a user
can choose to use config drive as needed. This adds ability to
disable/enable config drive and allows libvirt to listen for connections
on tcp as needed for live migrations (prohibited otherwise by config drive).

The following new variables were added to nova_common and nova_libvirt
roles, retaining their existing values:

nova_force_config_drive: always
nova_libvirtd_listen_tls: 0
nova_libvirtd_listen_tcp: 1
nova_libvirtd_auth_tcp: none

Conflicts:
  playbooks/roles/os_nova/defaults/main.yml
  playbooks/roles/os_nova/templates/nova.conf.j2

Change-Id: I1de35a4b3611b8bc33a21930dae3fd38f9aaa151
Closes-Bug: #1468514
DocImpact
(cherry picked from commit e65066cf1253c8a27d12c3e3da6797199f0016b5)

so that any client requirement versions are determined solely from
the requirements of the OpenStack service and Global requirements
files.

This resolves issues where the client versions we carry are
incompatible with the services, resulting in unexpected failures.

Tempest requirements are specifically ignored as the tempest role
downloads its required clients directly from pip.

commit_message:
Updated juno to include fix for CVE-2015-3241 - 26 Aug 2015

Updates all repo SHAs to include:
 - [OSSA 2015-015] Nova instance migration process does not stop when
   instance is deleted (CVE-2015-3241)
 - Cannot rebuild a VM created from a Cinder volume backed by NetApp
   https://review.openstack.org/203253

This patch removes all SHA specifications for the OpenStack clients
so that any client requirement versions are determined solely from
the requirements of the OpenStack service and Global requirements
files.

This resolves issues where the client versions we carry are
incompatible with the services, resulting in unexpected failures.

Tempest requirements are specifically ignored as the tempest role
downloads its required clients directly from pip.

Finally, due to the change in the openstack-client version used the
heat domain/role/user tasks fail as they require the CLI to specify
the user and project domain name/id. This patch includes the CLI
changes to ensure that the deployment completes properly.

Change-Id: I88e705d063575f55c32350ead25bc7cc0bcdec08
Closes-Bug: #1489947
Closes-Bug: #1488315
Closes-Bug: #1400881

', 'number': 3}, {'created': '2015-08-25 09:19:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fixing haproxy-playbook fails when installing on multiple hosts

This bug is triggered when haproxy is deployed on multiple hosts
and external_lb_vip is different than the internal one.
As all host receive the same configuration, and are expected
to restart the haproxy service more than once
(once during role and once post_tasks), the playbook will fail,
because the restart of the service fails. The restart of the
service fails on some hosts because haproxy tries to
start/bind to an ip the host doesn't have (avoiding ip conflicts)

This allows haproxy to bind on non_local addresses by
addng a sysctl change in the playbook: net.ipv4.ip_nonlocal_bind = 1
The sysctl is changed for the containers/systems by default.

Side-effect: other services are now able to bind on non-local addresses

This could be overriden by setting the variable haproxy_bind_on_non_local
in your user_* variables. If set to false, then the ip_non_local_bind
sysctl won't be changed.

Closes-Bug: #1487409

Change-Id: I41b3a5a4ba2d48192b505e3720456a77484aa92b

commit_message:
Fixing haproxy-playbook fails when installing on multiple hosts

This bug is triggered when haproxy is deployed on multiple hosts
and external_lb_vip is different than the internal one.
As all host receive the same configuration, and are expected
to restart the haproxy service more than once
(once during role and once post_tasks), the playbook will fail,
because the restart of the service fails. The restart of the
service fails on some hosts because haproxy tries to
start/bind to an ip the host doesn't have (avoiding ip conflicts)

This allows haproxy to bind on non_local addresses by
addng a sysctl change in the playbook: net.ipv4.ip_nonlocal_bind = 1
The sysctl is changed for the containers/systems
when external_lb_vip is different than internal address and
the number of haproxy hosts is more than one thanks to a group_var.

Side-effect: other services are able to bind on non-local addresses
if the sysctl is changed.

This could be overriden by setting the variable haproxy_bind_on_non_local
in your user_* variables. If set to false, then the ip_non_local_bind
sysctl won't be changed.

Closes-Bug: #1487409

Change-Id: I41b3a5a4ba2d48192b505e3720456a77484aa92b

commit_message:
Switch Rally gates to new DevStack plugin style

After this patch was merged: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/190601/
Rally gates become broken.

The check in jenkis/jobs/rally.yaml that should switch to new
plugin style doesn't work (it contains bug).
At this moment we are installing 2 versions of Rally
(with new and old way) one is master another one is master + patch.

As a result Rally gates are testing Rally master instead of
proposed patch to Rally.

This patch removes check of new/old style and use always new plugin style

Change-Id: Id17c1422e4b1ff350e16f76b6fcaa1ce3aa6f6b4

commit_message:
Disable keystone service token

Disable keystone service token in post deployment actions
since that token doesn't represent a user, and carries no
explicit authorization.

Change-Id: I4f2877df1da087f10673edfc855868ebb2245be3
Closes-Bug: #1486015

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-07-15 17:38:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Allow external services to define their providers

Service plugins may or may not have service providers. Neutron
should have no say into which providers are allowed and which
are not. This should be a responsibility of the service plugin
validation logic itself.

To this aim, this logic is removed from here and moved closer
to where it belongs.

Partial-bug: #1473110

Change-Id: Ia4cad678e6c722ca05821dbdbf05d61523246a86
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-07-16 00:50:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Try to decentralize the managemement of service providers

**WIP**

After the service split, some of the configuration, parsing and
validation was kept in the core; ultimately this needs to
decentralized and get closer to the services where it belongs.

This patch starts from ProviderConfiguration and ServiceTypeManager
classes, and attempts to rely less on hardcoded magic.

Partial-bug: #1473110

Change-Id: Ia4cad678e6c722ca05821dbdbf05d61523246a86
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-07-16 06:58:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Decentralize the managemement of service providers

After the service split, some of the configuration, parsing and
validation was kept in the neutron core; ultimately this needs to
get closer to the services where it belongs.

This patch starts from ProviderConfiguration and ServiceTypeManager
classes, and aims at removing the hard-coded elements, like the list
of known advanced services, so that in the long run we can make
Neutron easier to plug with external services.

Partial-bug: #1473110

Depends-on: I44edcceba37ac58efcc0a53c9d1f835d9530344a

commit_message:
Decentralize the managemement of service providers

After the service split, some of the configuration, parsing and
validation was kept in the neutron core; ultimately this needs to
get closer to the services where it belongs.

This patch starts from ProviderConfiguration and ServiceTypeManager
classes, and aims at removing the hard-coded elements, like the list
of known advanced services, so that in the long run we can make
Neutron easier to plug with external services.

Partial-bug: #1473110

commit_message:
Add federated auth for idp specific websso

This commit adds a call the federation API where federated authentication can
be initiated by knowing the identity provider ID, as well as the protocol ID.
This will result in the ability for Identity Provider specific Websso
authentication flows.

Change-Id: Ia84e2fba8337f5f1c1f59986020c7617b367bbc6
Implements: bp federation-idp-websso

commit_message:
Disable python buffering for gate checks

In order to ensure that the ansible output in the jenkins console
log is output as it comes it is necessary to turn off the python
output buffering.

Change-Id: I0f8f11cd04fdfd6c26d5a5afc0e8647648edb1bb

This patch implements tox.ini configuration for bashate and pep8
tests for the purpose of implementing the standard openstack-infra
tests for these.

subject: Switch Nova/Tempest to use/test Cinder API v2
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6816, 'name': 'Jesse Pretorius', 'email': 'jesse@odyssey4.me', 'username': 'jesse-pretorius'}, {'_account_id': 7217, 'name': 'Hugh Saunders', 'email': 'hugh@wherenow.org', 'username': 'hughsaunders'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 12807, 'name': 'Steve Lewis (stevelle)', 'email': 'stevelle@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevelle'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-18 07:22:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Switch tempest to test Cinder API v2

As per https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/deprecate-v1-api
the Cinder API v1 was designated as deprecated in Juno and was meant
to be removed in Kilo, but appears to still be usable in Kilo.

In Liberty gate checks using the Cinder v1 API we are getting
constant failures for the Cinder V1 API tests and related scenario
tests.

This patch turns off Cinder API v1 tests and turns on Cinder API v2
tests instead.

Change-Id: I6513c07e1b5d5653b84ad0b2b490ac8451f2bdf1
Related-Bug: #1481542
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-08-18 10:41:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Switch tempest to test Cinder API v2

As per https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/deprecate-v1-api
the Cinder API v1 was designated as deprecated in Juno and was meant
to be removed in Kilo, but appears to still be usable in Kilo.

In Liberty gate checks using the Cinder v1 API we are getting
constant failures for the Cinder V1 API tests and related scenario
tests.

This patch turns off Cinder API v1 tests and turns on Cinder API v2
tests instead.

This patch also ensure that nova is using the Cinder v2 API instead
of the v1 API.

Change-Id: I6513c07e1b5d5653b84ad0b2b490ac8451f2bdf1
Closes-Bug: #1481542
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-08-18 10:44:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Switch Nova/Tempest to use/test Cinder API v2

As per https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/deprecate-v1-api
the Cinder API v1 was designated as deprecated in Juno and was meant
to be removed in Kilo, but appears to still be usable in Kilo.

This patch configures Nova to use the Cinder v2 API instead of the
v1 API.

This patch configures Tempest to test the Cinder v2 API instead of
the v1 API.

DocImpact

commit_message:
Switch Nova/Tempest to use/test Cinder API v2

As per https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/deprecate-v1-api
the Cinder API v1 was designated as deprecated in Juno and was meant
to be removed in Kilo, but appears to still be usable in Kilo.

This patch configures Nova to use the Cinder v2 API instead of the
v1 API.

This patch configures Tempest to test both the Cinder v1 and v2 API's
for now. Once the API is removed upstream we can change this.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1481542
Change-Id: I6513c07e1b5d5653b84ad0b2b490ac8451f2bdf1

subject: Ansible register task for MariaDB incorrectly reports failure
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1390, 'name': 'Paul Bourke', 'email': 'pauldbourke@proton.me', 'username': 'pauldbourke'}, {'_account_id': 10787, 'name': 'Michal Jastrzebski (inc0)', 'email': 'michal.jastrzebski@intel.com', 'username': 'inc0'}, {'_account_id': 14119, 'name': 'Sam Yaple', 'email': 'sam+git@yaple.net', 'username': 'SamYaple'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-03 10:04:35.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/mariadb/tasks/register.yml'], 'message': 'Ansible register task for MariaDB incorrectly reports failure

When running register task for MariaDB we should firstly check
if operation failed before trying to parse result from json output

Change-Id: Ic331ec20990277d30b147826ff24affb27d52383
Closes-Bug: #1491751
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Ansible register task for MariaDB incorrectly reports failure

When running register task for MariaDB we should firstly check
if operation failed before trying to parse result from json output

Change-Id: Ic331ec20990277d30b147826ff24affb27d52383
Closes-Bug: #1491751

REST API for Murano Dashboard.

This patch adds the start of a horizon rest api module so that
javascript can wrap it. It also provides an AngularJS wrapper.

commit_message:
Allow cinder-backup to use ceph

This change updates ceph_client and os_cinder roles to allow
cinder-backup to use ceph.  We also create a new group called
'cinder_backup' which allows us to only retreive the cinder backup key
if cinder-backup is actually in use.

To use, you would simply need to set cinder_service_backup_driver to
cinder.backup.drivers.ceph in your user_variables.yml file.

NOTE: You will need to update your
      /etc/openstack_deploy/env.d/cinder.yml in order for this change
      to execute successfully.

Change-Id: Ib94effa40208bbc8de0f78c5487316be007adcf1
Closes-Bug: #1481787
Implements: blueprint ceph-block-devices
DocImpact

commit_message:
Implement asynchronous logger for event callbacks

Excludes any lock operations in EventMachine event loop
and its callbacks.

Now in EventMachine callbacks all writings to log are
performed in asynchronous fashion. This way we try to
exclude possibility of blocking and getting deadlock
using classic logging mechanism, which has plenty of
locks internally.

Also similar problem was seen in the next ticket #1453573.

Co-Authored-By: Evgeniy L <eli@mirantis.com>

Closes-Bug: #1487397
Change-Id: I72d0eb01ef8c87e10003338bd3bb70e42a4b7dd6

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/core-vendor-decomposition

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-09-03 03:32:52.000000000', 'files': ['doc/image-guide/ch_openstack_images.xml'], 'message': 'XenAPI will not inject ssh-key if cloud-init

commit_message:
XenAPI will not inject ssh-key if cloud-init

The XenAPI does not inject an ssh-key if an image
has the "cloud_init_installed" property. Cloud-init
handles key injection.

Closes-bug: 1206943
Change-Id: Iab2ce12b742599491e47a8643c5b83c8e273ad3c

commit_message:
Change get_extensions_path to remove duplicate paths

Split the api_extensions_path in get_extensions_path() so that
duplicated locations in the path can be removed.If not, then it
is possible that the same module is loaded twice due to duplicated
paths, which can cause error.

Closes-bug: #1486861
Change-Id: I7de1e20ab6ff519e51e52b869574931dcf8da797

commit_message:
Prevent ilo drivers powering off active nodes during take over

Currently, ilo drivers powers off active nodes
when a conductor takes over the node from another conductor.
This commit stops this, as active nodes shouldn't be powered
off during take over.

Closes-bug: 1490019
Change-Id: I8e54ae148ed9cfdcb6639a4d089ee82f14de53ba

commit_message:
Add support for group membership to data driven assignment tests

Enable testing of effective mode for groups with the data driven
tests for list_role_assignment, plus provide one example of its
use.

Follow-on patches will expand the use of data driven test to
expand coverage.

Partially Implements: bp data-driven-tests
Change-Id: I6d6ae4e6851dfa32e3745767d4f20c74da135cdc

having wrong name

subject: Add/Overwrite default images in IMAGE_URLS and detect duplicates
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 6735, 'name': 'Bob Ball', 'email': 'bob.ball@citrix.com', 'username': 'bob-ball'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 8074, 'name': 'Jin Nan Zhang', 'username': 'zhangjinnan', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12487, 'name': 'vigneshvar', 'email': 'vigneshvar.a.s@gmail.com', 'username': 'vigneshvar'}, {'_account_id': 17169, 'name': 'John Hua', 'email': 'ihuazhihao@gmail.com', 'username': 'johnhua'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-07-14 11:18:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Incorrect IMAGE_URLS for ironic and xenserver

The default setting of IMAGE_URLS is given in stackrc, while
tools/xen/README.md will still suggest user to set it in localrc with
a duplicated value(i.e. http://download.cirros-cloud.net/0.3.4/cirros
-0.3.4-x86_64-uec.tar.gz) and thus causes a conflict of image upload.

Although IMAGE_URLS could be originally set in localrc, stackrc will
partially overwrite "https://github.com/downloads/citrix-openstack/
warehouse/cirros-0.3.0-x86_64-disk.vhd.tgz" and indiscriminately append
"http://download.cirros-cloud.net/${CIRROS_VERSION}/cirros-
${CIRROS_VERSION}-x86_64-disk.img". Thus it will possibly upload the
image twice if user sets a same url in localrc and cause a
"409 Conflict" error. Actually if user follows the steps suggested by
tools/xen/README.md, the problem will definitely occur.

The same issue also happens to ironic.

Change-Id: I3ca4e576aa3fb8992c08ca44900a8c53dd4b4163
Closes-Bug: #1473432
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-07-14 11:19:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Incorrect IMAGE_URLS for ironic and xenserver

commit_message:
Add/Overwrite default images in IMAGE_URLS and detect duplicates

IMAGE_URLS could be set both in localrc with customization or stackrc by
default. By setting DOWNLOAD_DEFAULT_IMAGES, user could choose to add
default images to IMAGE_URLS or overwrite them.

As uploading duplicate images will cause a "409 Conflict" error, a
duplicate detection will expose it earlier.

Care needs to be taken that you don't end up with a duplicate image, so
clean up Xen's README.

Depends-On: I6fbae12f950a03afab39f341132746d3db9f788c
Change-Id: I3ca4e576aa3fb8992c08ca44900a8c53dd4b4163
Closes-Bug: #1473432

commit_message:
Increase httplib._MAXHEADERS to 256.

By default Swift increase the number of max metadata count to 90
and extra header count to 32. That mean we can put 90 metadata to
Account/Container/Object by default, when user put 90 metadata to a
Account, the Account header count is close or more than 100. The
swift client unable to access Account and get an error likes,

('Connection aborted.', HTTPException('got more than 100 headers',))

So the default _MAXHEADERS(100) won't enough.

Change-Id: I5ffc4eb5d3e1ebc3dbdd7dc69376919ae3e1c5a8

commit_message:
Fix exception message mistake in WSGI service

The error message when providing a backlog argument either zeroed or negative
 needs to be i18n and also fixed to match with the conditional.

Change-Id: Ib9e15091826e8a68289d90b53116837770e826c7
Closes-Bug: #1487350

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-07-02 02:58:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Themeing Mechanism now supports 3rd party themes

In order to fascilate the bulk of the CSS Reorg effort, it will be extremely
beneficial to quickly toggle between many different themes in order to validate
proper cascading inheritance.  This work prompted the following example theme.

The 'material' theme gives an example of how to incorporate a 3rd party theme
into the new Themeing functionality.  In addition to incorporating a theme,
loaded as a static asset using requirements.txt, it also gives examples of how
to cleanly override styles, variables, icon fonts and Django templates.

Change-Id: Ic67189de5aac5ca541ad6fe82b823e8fcf318bd0
Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-theme-css-reorg

", 'number': 10}, {'created': '2015-07-22 17:05:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Theming Mechanism now supports 3rd party themes

In order to fascilate the bulk of the CSS Reorg effort, it will be extremely
beneficial to quickly toggle between many different themes in order to validate
proper cascading inheritance.  This work prompted the following example theme.

The 'material' theme gives an example of how to make use of a 3rd party theme
using the theming functionality.  In addition to incorporating a theme,
loaded as a static asset using requirements.txt, it also gives examples of how
to cleanly override styles, variables, icon fonts and Django templates.

To test and make use of this theme, add the theme to your local_settings.py:
CUSTOM_THEME_PATH = 'static/themes/material', recollect and recompress your
static files.

Change-Id: Ic67189de5aac5ca541ad6fe82b823e8fcf318bd0

commit_message:
Theming Mechanism now supports 3rd party themes

In order to facilitate the bulk of the CSS Reorg effort, it was
extremely beneficial to quickly toggle between many different themes
in order to validate proper cascading inheritance.  This work
prompted the following example theme.

The 'material' theme gives an example of how to make use of a 3rd
party theme using the theming functionality.  In addition to
incorporating a theme, loaded as a static asset using
requirements.txt, it also gives examples of how to cleanly override
styles, variables, icon fonts and Django templates.

This theme is replacing 'blue' as the example of how to use a theme
other than 'default'.

To use this theme, add the theme to your local_settings.py:
CUSTOM_THEME_PATH = 'themes/material', recollect and recompress your
static files.

Change-Id: Ic67189de5aac5ca541ad6fe82b823e8fcf318bd0
Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-theme-css-reorg

commit_message:
Modify recommend_configs arguments in vanilla 1

Although recommentdations in vanilla 1 plugin aren't supported, the
arguments of method recommend_configs in versionhandler should be
consistent with version 2. Otherwise, the creation of cluster will
fail with Internal Server Error.

Change-Id: Ic0b6fcc4cd51bcc4095a2e3f9db80abb40b415d7
Closes-Bug: #1490723

commit_message:
Run py34 first in default tox run

this avoids py34 failure in default tox run when testrepository is
not yet initialized (e.g. fresh repo clone).

Change-Id: I95d3590ebd67dc4f2c3a53b3da50a3d3ed481f7f
Closes-Bug: #1489059

use data-processing rather than data_processing.

commit_message:
[Sahara] Support autoconfiguration for templates

This patch introduces ability to switch on/off autoconfiguration
for cluster and node group templates.

Required saharaclient was released and added to
global-requirements.

Implements blueprint: recommend-configuration
Change-Id: I9f9b68102420d5bf147369e3e4f61f594d1b825c

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-05 14:09:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Stable Keystone Driver Interfaces

* Added a new Metaclass 'CompatiblizerMeta' that will ensure that
  + the driver version either matches the current interface version or
    the previous one
  + if its the previous, it'll introduce the compatibility methods defined
    in the 'Compatibilizer' class into the driver
  + if the 'Compatibilizer' class doesn't have a corresponding method
    implemented for any not-implemented-abstract-method of driver,
    then it'll raise exception

* Added INTERFACE_VERSION and 'Compatibilizer' classes to all 'core.py'
  files containing Driver interfaces

* Added DRIVER_VERSION to all backend
  implementations in 'sql.py', 'ldap.py' files

* Added two new exception classes pertaining to incompatibility

Implements bp stable-driver-interfaces

Change-Id: I0078f6dc32932beb6db534ecf22b160097c5a090

commit_message:
Stable Keystone Driver Interfaces

Extended support for versioned driver classes to the rest of the
backends based on the design of the initial support for catalog backend @
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/218481/

partially Implements bp stable-driver-interfaces

Change-Id: I0078f6dc32932beb6db534ecf22b160097c5a090

[{'created': '2015-03-19 18:03:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Use CirrOS image in Neutron Loadbalancer test

This should decrease the load on the gate.

Test template was rewritten to use ResourceGroup, wait conditions and
outputs, so no other client than heat one is used, and there is no need
to check for VM connectivity, as stack status COMPLETE now quite
reliably means that the listening servers are runnning.

Also, two options where added to config:
- floating_network_name (defaults to 'public')
- minimal_instance_type (for use with cirros images, defaults to
  'm1.nano')

Change-Id: Iec8e8061f9ab3f3841fa221722b7b7805760cdf7
Related-Bug: #1433555

commit_message:
Merge Neutron AutoScaling and LoadBalancer tests

The tested use case is an autoscaling group of web app servers
behind a loadbalancer.

Test template was rewritten to use AutoScalingGroup, wait conditions and
outputs, so no other client than heat one is used.
Now there is no need to check for VM connectivity,
as stack/resources status COMPLETE now quite reliably means
that the listening servers are running.

This patch should probably also help with narrowing down the causes of
bug 1437203, since it does not checks instance connectivity with SSH.

Change-Id: Iec8e8061f9ab3f3841fa221722b7b7805760cdf7
Related-Bug: #1437203
Closes-Bug: #1435285

commit_message:
Allow specifying a region name to auth_token

The keystone that is used to validate tokens is determined from the
service catalog. If you have multiple identity entries in your service
catalog then you need to specify the region to use.

Add a region_name option.

Change-Id: I512dbcdc7031f476d691b7ce09b7c6411900ea9e
Closes-Bug: #1405717

commit_message:
Add accessor method for raw catalog content

There are cases, such as os_auth in ansible, where a user wants to
be able to get at the raw catalog content. This is often extremely
useful when debugging cloud applications.

Change-Id: Ibe51b5f1a4b1d93efb6076b5f97b0fd10376cd16

commit_message:
Rename docs dir to doc for publishing

The publishing docs expect the documentation to be present in the
/doc directory not the /docs directory.  If the documentation is in
the /docs directory, according to fungi the docs won't be published
properly.

Change-Id: I718fec7e69d298a5cb2376ca4e2455e12169566e
Partially-Implements: blueprint kola-tox-doc

[{'created': '2015-07-29 02:01:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add the ability to update volume type public status

Currently, the v2 volume type update api doesn't support updating volume type's
public status. All volume types created are public by default if not specified,
It is not possible to update a existing volume_type is_public status.
It is necessary to add updating public status for volume type. If a volume

not be affected, but the user without access will not be able to create volume
with this type anymore.

Implements blueprint: volume-types-public-update
